Build

The super sleek smartwatch has a round body. It is lightweight yet has a durable body made of aircraft-grade aluminum alloy. An elegant rotatable crown crowns the ergonomic design of the Amazfit GTR 3. The bezel-less design integrates wonderfully with the curved glass screen. It helps heighten immersion when using the device. The comfortable and stylish straps match and fit your choice of dressing: office suits, workout gear, casual wear, etc. the smartwatch is available in Moonlight Grey, with the watch body made from Aluminum alloy and an antibacterial silicone strap.

Display

The clear, 1.39-inch HD AMOLED Display stands out on the Amazfit GTR 3. It has unprecedented clarity that reaches up to 454 x 454p (~326 ppi), 1,000 nit brightness and a 66% screen-to-body ratio. It is visible under bright sunlight. The touchscreen is protected by tempered glass with an anti-fingerprint coating.

Watch Faces

Amazfit GTR 3 has 100+ watch faces with Always-on-Displays. The AOD include 15 Animated Watch Faces and 8 Editable Watch Faces. You can upload your own photos to the watch faces for an intimate, personalized smart watch look.

Operating System

Use the powerful Zepp OS to get information and accurate data on your smartwatch promptly.

Health Management

Amazfit GTR 3 has an advanced 6PD (Six Photodiodes) BioTracker PP3 3.0 biometric sensor that can track multiple health metrics simultaneously while using more optical light. You can test your heart rate, blood-oxygen saturation, stress levels and breathing rate with one single tap of the watch. You will get the results on the 4 metrics in 45 seconds and be able to make informed choices.

Hands-free Lifestyle

Alexa’s built-in and Offline Voice Assistant enables online and offline hands-free use of your smartwatch. The Zepp App allows smooth interaction in an enriched App Ecosystem. You can easily set the alarm, ask questions and get the translation with Alexa, in-built into the Amazfit GTR 3. If offline, you can still use the Offline Voice Assistant to perform operations such as engaging in a sport mode or opening a health metric feature through voice commands.

Battery

Enjoy 21-day battery life from the day you fully charge your device until the next time you need to recharge it. It will last 10 days of heavy usage, 35 hours of GPS continuous usage, and 35 days in battery saver mode.

Sensors

The device has several sensors installed on the unit. They include:

  • Health Sensor: Bio-Tracker 3.0 PPG biometric sensor
  • Movement Sensors: Accelerometer, Gyro, Geomagnetic, Barometric pressor, and Ambient Light Sensors
  • Positioning Sensors: GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, BDS, QZSS
  • Connection Sensors: Bluetooth 5.1 BLE

description:
Oppo Reno 7 5G in Kenya

The Oppo Reno 7 5G price in Kenya is around Ksh 54,500. The Reno 7 5G comes with a 6.43-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 1080×2400 pixels and an aspect ratio of 20:9. It is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 778G 5G (6 nm) processor and runs Android 11  powered by a 4500mAh non-removable battery. It has an AMOLED screen of 90Hz refresh rate and an under-display fingerprint scanner across the board.

Reno 7 5G specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh. 54,500
Display 6.43″ inch AMOLED, 90Hz
Processor Qualcomm SM7325 Snapdragon 778G 5G (6 nm)
Sim Card Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by)
Connectivity GSM / CDMA / HSPA / EVDO / LTE / 5G
OS Android 11, ColorOS 11.1
RAM 8GB
Storage 256GB
Card Slot up to 256GB (dedicated slot)
Rear Camera 64MP+8MP+2MP
Front Camera 32 MP(wide)
3.5mm Jack Yes
USB Port USB Type-C 3.1
Fingerprint  Under the display, optical
Battery Non-removable Li-Po 4500 mAh
Battery charging 60W
Color Black, Blue, Gold, Red (New Year Edition)

Design

The design of the Oppo Reno 7 5G looks stunning most, especially the back panel as it shimmers and changes colors depending on the angle of the lighting. On its upper left is a camera setup which gives the camera lens an illusion as if it was floating on a piece of glass. The back also has this frosted glass texture which is very effective in repelling fingerprints and smudges. The Reno 7 5G comes in Stary Black, and Startrails Blue.

Situated on the upper left side of the display is the selfie camera. And right in the upper bezel is the earpiece it’s gut-thin bezels all around and a thick chin. This phone has a triple sim card tray for two nano-sized SIM cards and a dedicated micro SD card slot. The power button and volume rocker are on opposite sides. At the bottom is a USB type C 3.5-millimeter audio Jack, main microphone, and speaker grills.

Display

The Oppo Reno 7 5G has a sizeable 6.4 inch AMOLED panel which comes with a 90 Hz screen refresh rate and a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels. The display comes protected with coining gorilla glass 5 and preinstalled screen protector. This display’s quality is what you would expect on an AMOLED panel with vibrant colors and deep plaques, and is viewable even under direct sunlight because of up to 800 nits of peak brightness. There’s also the dark mode in the settings on this HDR10+ display that lets you set how dark you want to go. For biometrics and security. there’s facial recognition and an in-display fingerprint scanner both work as intended.

Cameras

Now to the cameras. Oppo Reno 7 5G has a triple-lens setup, which consists of a 64 MP, f/1.7, 26mm (wide), 8 MP, f/2.2, 119˚ (ultrawide), and a 2 MP, f/2.4, (macro). Flipping to the front is its 32-megapixel sensor. The main sensor can produce a well-balanced exposure, which sometimes is hard to achieve in other devices on this tier. Since there is no telephoto lens, you will have to rely mostly on the main camera for digitally zooming in on a subject. Background and subject separations can be amazing when you know how to produce these. The Reno 7 5g can record a maximum resolution of [email protected] The video quality is excellent as it has vibrant colors and sharp details.

Performance

Powering Oppo Reno 7 5G is Android 11, ColorOS 12. There are tons of customization options here. For example, you can change icon styles, app layout, fingerprint animation, fonts, colors, and edge lighting. Out of the 256GB storage of Oppo Reno 7, 5G you have 230GB left which is ample for most users. The good news is if you think you need more, there’s a micro SD card slot in the mix. This phone packs a MediaTek MT6877 Dimensity 900 (6 nm) chipset with a Mali-G68 MC4 GPU. It comes with 8GB RAM with a 5GB RAM expansion feature. When it comes to connectivity, the Reno 7 5G includes Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.2, GPS, NFC, dual 5gGconnection, and a USB type C port. And for the battery performance, it packs a Li-Po 4500 mAh, non-removable pack with support for 65W, 100% in 31 minutes of fast charging and reverse charging.

Oppo Reno 7 5G FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

  1. What is the release date for Oppo Reno7 5G (Global)? – The official release date is 2022, February 04.
  2. How much does Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) cost? – The base approximate price of the Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) is 54,000 in Kenya.
  3. What is the screen size of the Oppo Reno7 5G (Global), and how big is it? – The screen size of the Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) is 6.43″ inches.
  4. Does Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) support 5G? – Yes, it supports 5G.
  5. Is Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) waterproof? – No, it is not waterproof.
  6. Does Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) have fast charging? – Yes, it supports fast charging.
  7. Does Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) have wireless charging? – No, it does not support wireless charging.
  8. Does Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) have Google Play Services? ? – Yes, it supports the services of Google Play Store, Gmail, youtube, etc.
  9. How many cameras does the Oppo Reno7 5G (Global) have? – There is a Triple main camera and a single selfie camera.

description:
Xiaomi 12 in Kenya

The Xiaomi 12 price in Kenya is around KSh 85,000. The Xiaomi 12 packs a 6.28-inch FHD+ flexible OLED screen with up to 1100 nit peak brightness, and a 120Hz refresh rate. The smartphone is powered by Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 with up to 12GB of  RAM and 256GB of storage. It packs a 4,500mAh battery with 67W fast charging that can charge up to 100% in 39 minutes, 50W wireless charging for 100% charge in 53 minutes, and 10W reverse wireless charging. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Xiaomi 12 Specs and price in Kenya

Price  in Kenya Ksh. 85,000
Display 6.28-inch, Full HD+ AMOLED, 1B colors, 120Hz, HDR10+, 1100 nits
Processor Qualcomm SM8450 Snapdragon 8 Gen1 (4 nm)
Sim Card Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by)
Connectivity GSM / CDMA / HSPA / EVDO / LTE / 5G
OS Android 12, MIUI 13
RAM 8GB RAM
ROM  256GB
Card Slot N0
Camera 50MP +  13MP +  5MP
Selfie 32 MP
3.5mm jack Yes, with stereo speakers
USB Port USB Type-C 2.0, USB On-The-Go
Fingerprint Fingerprint (under display, optical)
Battery Li-Po 4600 mAh, non-removable
Charging  67W wired fast charging, 50W wireless second charge, 10W Wireless rechargeable
Colors Black, Green, Blue, Pink

Unboxing and Design

The first thing we see with this box is that big 67W charger. Yes, Xiaomi includes it in the package, which these days with flagships seems to be such a big thing. Once you open up the box, you will be greeted by a little insert with a SIM Ejector pin, regular literature, and a soft case. This is very much appreciated given that the back here is Glass. And depending on the color you go for it will be a Black, Green, Blue, or Pink smartphone in the box. The Green version, by the way, is not glass but vegan leather. Anyway, this phone has got a USB type C cable with an orange accent.

A quick tour around the Xiaomi 12 device will show the power and volume keys and the SIM tray. There’s no IP certification here and there is also no support for micro SD. The USB port you see over here is just USB Type-C 2.0 so transfer speeds are gonna be relatively low. And there is no headphone jack. On the flip side, there are stereo speakers. These are tuned by Harmon Kardon. There’s also support for Dolby Atmos from a software perspective. They’ve even retained the IR blaster. One of the last brands to do so.

Compared to Pro Version

The first thing that Xiaomi 12 doesn’t have compared to the Pro variant is the 127W charger. This one has a 67W one which is still something do not get me wrong. And as far as wireless charging goes, both of them are the same 50W wireless charging and 10W reverse wireless. The battery capacity is different in that this one has 4500 mAh compared to Li-Po 4600 mAh.

The next difference is with these displays. Here you get 6.28 inches compared to 6.73 on the Pro. And this is a Full HD Plus compared to Quad HD Plus. But both are AMOLED panels with 120Hz refresh rates. But the next difference is that the Pro gets an LTPO panel which means it can switch between 60 and 120 Hz. Perhaps other differences worth mentioning are 419 PPI density compared to 521 PPI density and 50MP + 13MP + 5MP camera compared to 50MP + 50MP + 50MP camera on the Pro version.

Cameras

First off, let us start by saying we absolutely adore the camera on the Xiaomi 12. Its great design choice makes it look really pleasant. Now the three sensors you see here are totally different from the three sensors you’ll find on the Xiaomi 12 Pro. Does that mean these cameras are bad? Well, the primary shooter is a 50 MP, f/1.9, 26mm (wide), 1/1.56″, 1.0µm, PDAF, OIS lens. Its images are decent the results of which are comparable to Samsung Galaxy S21 FE 5G’s. The secondary shooter is a 13 MP, f/2.4, 12mm, 123˚ (ultrawide), 1/3.06″, 1.12µm lens and the third a 5 MP, 50mm (telephoto macro), AF lens.

There is up to [email protected] (HDR10) video recording with the main camera. Other qualities include [email protected] (HDR10+), [email protected]/120/240/960fps, [email protected], gyro-EIS. So actually how are the selfies of this Xiaomi 12? They are crisp, sharp, and well-detailed. We think Xiaomi has done a good job with edge detection on the portraits. These are made possible by Xiaomi 12’s 32 MP, 26mm (wide), 0.7µm front-facing lens.

Display

The Xiaomi 12 is easy to use single-handed thanks to its large edge-to-edge curved screen. Underneath its display is an optical fingerprint scanner. It’s pretty fast, pretty responsive. Nothing really to complain about it save for its placement? It is a bit lower than usual. Even lower than how it has been placed on the Pro version. On top of the display is a hole punch. This houses its 30MP selfie camera.

The display features here are as follows:

  • OLED, 1B colors, 120Hz, Dolby Vision, HDR10+, 1100 nits (peak)
  • 6.28 inches, 95.2 cm2 (~89.2% screen-to-body ratio)
  • 1080 x 2400 pixels, 20:9 ratio (~419 PPI density)
  • Corning Gorilla Glass Victus

Let us also talk about software. What you are getting here is the new MIUI 13 built on top of Android 12. Given the hardware underneath, Qualcomm SM8450 Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 (4 nm), 8 or 12 GB of DDR5 RAM, 128 or 256 GB of UFS 3.1 storage. With this combination and the 120 Herz display, the Xiaomi 12 feels very snappy. News flash, this is one of the first phones to break the 1 million mark AnTuTu. The Xiaomi 12 is one of the first phones to launch with the latest Qualcomm SM8450 Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 (4 nm) chipset. Yes, the one that’s been breaking records all over.

description:
Infinix Note 12 G96 in Kenya

The Infinix Note 12 price in Kenya is around Ksh 27,200. The phone has 8GB RAM and 128 GB of internal storage which is expandable using microSDXC. The Note 12 runs on Android 12, which is powered by a 5000 mAh battery. As for the cameras, it has a 50MP primary rear camera along with a 2MP depth sensor and AI sensor. The Infinix Note 12 comes in Force Black, Snowfall, and Sapphire Blue (Jewel Blue) colors. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Infinix Note 12 G96 specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya From Ksh. 27,200
Display 6.7 inches, AMOLED
Processor MediaTek Helio G96
Sim Card Dual SIM
Connectivity GSM / HSPA / LTE
OS Android 12
RAM 8GB
Storage 128GB, 256GB
Card Slot microSDXC
Main Camera 50MP+ 2MP +QVGA
Selfie Camera 16MP
3.5mm jack Yes
USB Port USB Type-C 2.0
Fingerprint side-mounted
Battery Li-Po 5000 mAh
Charging Fast Charging 33W
Colors Force Black, Snowfall, Sapphire Blue (Jewel Blue)

An Overview

Infinix Note 12 G96 is a mid-range smartphone that is budget-friendly and suitable for users looking for value for their money. The 4G-enabled handset comes packed with a 6.7-inch AMOLED display, with a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels (~393 PPI density). Considering the peak brightness of the Infinix Note 12 is at 1,000 nits, it has one of the brightest screens on modern handsets available on the market. Measuring 164.6 x 76.8 x 8 mm and weighing 185g, Note 12 G96 is fairly thin and light to carry around. It has feather-light proportions that emphasize form and function.

Running on Android 12, XOS 10.6, and with an Octa-core MediaTek Helio G96 (12nm), Infinix Note 12 g96 has a powerful processor and operating system to multi-task, enable quick browsing, and consumption of multimedia content. The device comes packed with a front 16MP selfie camera and 50MP+2MP+QVGA main camera at the back to capture precious life moments. Infinix Note 12  G96 is powered by a massive 5,000mAh Li-Po non-removable battery, complementing a 33W wired fast charger. It is now available in retail at Phoneplace Kenya in Force Black, Snowfall, and Sapphire Blue (Jewel Blue) color variants. The Infinix Note 12 price in Kenya is Kes 27,500.

Build, Design and Display

Infinix Note 12 G96 is made of glass in the front, a plastic body frame, and a plastic back. The handset has flat surfaces, with a slight bump at the back where the main camera system is housed. The plastic general body build makes the device light, considering it weighs 185g and measures 164.6 x 76.8 x 8 mm. The Infinix Note 12 G96 edges are curved and complement the handset’s ergonomic design. The feather-light proportions and sleek design of the device embody form and function.

The 6.7-inches FHD+ display on the device dominates the front of the water drop screen. 60Hz refresh rate enables screen peak performance when browsing, playing video games, or chatting. The 6.7-inch accurate color display AMOLED Display enables higher efficiency and lower consumption. Supersize your views as a user with the 6.7-inch Infinity Display that yields a crystal clear brightness even in broad daylight. A resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels (~393 PPI) enables a great user experience when using the device to browse and capture moments and entertainment.

Performance and Battery Capacity.

Infinix Note 12 G96 got equipped with ultra-gaming Mediatek MT6781 Helio G96 (12 nm) processors. It packs more speed and power, incorporating an Octa-core (2*Cortex‑A76 & 6*Cortex‑A55 processors), simultaneously harnessing next-level intelligence for groundbreaking performance. The handset has 8GB RAM, which could get extended by 5GB up to 13GB. The extension capabilities of the RAM not only improve the smartphone’s processing speed but also accelerate performance when performing various functions and tasks.

A 5,000mAh Li-OP non-removable battery powers the operating system and the entire handset. The intelligence battery enables long-lasting use. It has a charge cycle as high as 800, without any notable degradation to the battery. The 33W wired fast charger allows Flash Charging.

For gamers, the Infinix Note 12 G96 has answers to your questions. The Monster Gaming Kit makes up an immersive gaming system that redefines your experience through Omnidirectional Optimization. The Gaming Kit includes:

  • XArena Darklink 2.0 which learns your usage patterns to optimize battery, temperature, and memory so you can maximize gameplay performance;
  • Dual Speakers with DTS that enables you to tune in on a set of dedicated dual speakers that produce 360° surround sound quality;
  • Linear Motor Tactile System offers various haptic feedback and vibrational techniques depending on the usage scenario. So whether you are playing your favorite game, texting, or using the calculator, every setting feels intuitive and unique to the touch; 10-layer Graphene Cooling System will enable you to experience up to a 60C reduction in core temperature

Camera

Re-imagine photographic excellence with the 50MP Night Triple Camera. The primary camera makes your snaps look like a work of art. It features 8160*6120 Ultrahigh Resolution, 1/2.8 Large Image Sensor, and 1.28μm Large Pixel Size. The Profession Night Scene Photography Mode makes the Infinix Note 12 G96 one of the best camera phones available on the market. The primary camera (50 MP, f/1.6, (wide), 1/2.8″, 0.64µm, PDAF) gets complemented by a 2 MP, f/2.4, (depth) sensor and QVGA. It captures 2K Videos at 30fps. You can capture selfies using the 16 MP, f/2.0, (wide) camera, which features a dual-LED Flash. It captures 1440p videos @30fps.

Network and Connectivity

The device supports up to 4G-Network connectivity. It uses GSM / LTE  technology for networking and connectivity and maximizes connection with HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE specification speed specifications. The USB Type-C 2.0 enables charging and transfer of data through the USB On-The-Go  (OTG) option. Wireless connection is enabled through Bluetooth (5.0, A2DP, LE) and WLAN (Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, dual-band, Wi-Fi Direct, hotspot). A side-mounted sensor enhances the device’s security by limiting people who access data and use the handset. Other sensors are the accelerometer, gyro, proximity, and compass. The device uses GPS (A-GPS), particularly useful when seeking locations and navigating by motorists.

Alternatives Devices to Infnix Note 12 G96

  • Infinix Note 12i
  • Nokia G20
  • Xiaomi POCO M3
  • Samsung Galaxy A32

FAQs

  • What material is used on Infinix Note 12 G96? Glass front, plastic frame, plastic back
  • What are the dimensions of the Infinix Note 12 G96? 6 x 76.8 x 8 mm 
  • What is the expected size of the Infinix Note 12 G96? A 7-inch Display
  • Does the Infinix Note 12 G96 display have protection? Corning Gorilla Glass 3
  • What is the resolution of the Infinix Note 12 G96? 1080 x 2400 pixels (~393 ppi density)
  • Does the Infinix Note 12 G96 have a MicroSD slot? It has a dedicated MicroSD slot up to 2TB
  • What is the RAM in the Infinix Note 12 G96? It comes with 8GB options.
  • What is the internal memory capacity of the Infinix Note 12 G96? 128GB and 256GB.
  • Does Infinix Note 12 G96 support 5G? It supports Network Connectivity up to 4G.
  • Does the Infinix Note 12 G96 support fast charging? It supports fast charging with the 33W fast charger.
  • What colors are available for Infinix Note 12 G96? Force Black, Snowfall, Sapphire Blue (Jewel Blue).
  • Is the Infinix Note 12 G96 good for gaming? It has a dedicated Gaming Mode Kit which enables optimal user experience when gaming.

Tecno Pop 6 overview

The Tecno Pop 6 brings competitive pricing to significantly cheaper options, with a budget performance device. The phone offers an immersive 6.1 IPS LCD screen, a primary 5MP camera, 5W normal charging, a massive battery at 5000mAh, and all that is powered by a MediaTek chipset. The Pop 6 comes off as a beautiful yet budget device, with a promise of a great value proposition.

Design

The Tecno Pop 6 comes with a 6.1″ HD+ Dot Notch screen with a dew drop notch for the selfie camera. The phone has a plastic build quality, so the front and back panel are smash resistant. The phone has a headphone jack and a mono speaker whose sound is surprisingly clear when playing media. The Pop 6 has a physical fast fingerprint sensor, conveniently placed on at the rear, that feels fast too.

Performance

The Tecno Pop 6 has a MediaTek quad-core processor paired with an ARM Mali GPU. As for the storage options, the phone has 2G RAM  and 32GB internal storage. It has an expandable memory option with a dedicated slot. The phone runs on Android 11 Go Edition, so the performance isn’t all that shabby. Android Go Edition ideally has less bloatware as compared to the ordinary Android so it shouldn’t lag or feel heavy. Everything feels decently fast and snappy.

Cameras

The Tecno Pop 6 has a dual-camera arrangement on the back. It comes with a decent single 5MP primary sensor for those fairly usable daylight photos. It has extra QVGA depth sensors, one to add portrait and more accurate distance distinction to the photos & the other is unspecified. The video can support up to 720p video at 30 fps, with HDR support. The selfie camera is a decent 5MP wide sensor, capable of 720p video at 30fps. The selfies are great and well-lit.

Other features

The Tecno Pop 6 comes with a Long-lasting and powerful 5000mAh  battery. This should be more than enough even for the power user. In this case, it’s a little obvious that is no wireless charging here. Similarly, priced phones would include Huawei Y5P, Nokia C10, Infinix HD Smart 2021, and the Tecno Pop 5 Go. the main distinctions at this price point is often a choice of a better camera or larger screen. The sizes are usually standard and the batteries are often huge. It’s unlikely there are fast charging options as the price is too competitive.

Tecno Pop 6 FAQ

  1. How much is Pop 6 in Kenya: the phone is currently retailing at Ksh 11700
  2. Where can I buy Pop 6 in Kenya: you can buy it at phoneplacekenya.com, both online and offline, with optional delivery on request.
  3. Does Pop 6 have fast charging: no. at this price point, the competition is too tight to allow such a feature. It however does come with 10W charging for the standard micro USB cable.
  4. Does Pop 6 have expandable memory: yes, it does, in a dedicated slot, so that it feels like the internal storage is not enough, you can always add more. It supports up to 128 GB
  5. What OS does Pop 6 support: it comes with the Android Go edition which eases off the processor considering it’s a budget device. That means it has more processing power for other activities, while still having less bloatware.

description:
Infinix Hot 12

The Infinix Hot 12 has a recommended price of 19,500 shillings in Kenya. It features a 6.82 inches display and MediaTek Helio G85 (12nm) chipset with Mali-G52 MC2 GPU. The phone also comes with a triple 13 MP + 2 MP + QVGA rear camera and an 8 MP front camera for selfies. Infinix Hot 12 runs on Android 12, XOS 10.6, and a 5000 mAh battery powers all this. Buy the Infinix Hot 12 in Kenya for 19,500 shillings at Phoneplace. It is available in colors Racing Black, Legend White, Origin Blue, and Lucky Green.

Infinix Hot 12 specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh. 19,500
Display 6.82 inches, IPS LCD, 90Hz
Processor Mediatek Helio G85 (12 nm)
Sim Card Dual SIM
Connectivity GSM / HSPA / LTE
OS Android 12, XOS 10.6
RAM 4GB
ROM 128GB
Card Slot microSDXC
Camera 13 MP + 2 MP + QVGA
Selfie 8MP, Dual-LED flash
3.5mm jack Yes
USB Port Yes
Fingerprint side-mounted
Battery Li-Po 5000 mAh
Charging Fast charging 18W
Colors Black, White, Blue, Green

Unboxing

Opening the box, the first thing you’ll see is the smartphone. Depending on the one you choose it will be Racing Black, Legend White, Origin Blue, or Lucky Green. In the box, you also get a customer service card and a SIM ejector tool warranty card. What this card means is if you happen to break your display within the first 30 days of activation, it will be replaced for free. PS: By Infinix. Still in the box is a pamphlet, free fire stickers, a $25 free fire gift card voucher, one X Gold note, a free fire plastic case that looks amazing, an 18 Watts charger, a USB type C cable, and earphones.

Design and Build

For the build quality, the Infinix Hot 12 has a plastic rear plastic frame with a flash edge design and glass at the front. No, it doesn’t have an IP rating. But if you happen to drop it inside water for a few seconds, it should survive. As for its external features, this phone has a dual SIM card on a memory tray. At the top there’s nothing, the right side has the volume and power button which is also the fingerprint scanner that unlocks the smartphone instantly.

At the bottom, there’s a 3.5 mm. Audio Jack, a microphone, a USB-type port, and one of its speakers. Yes, Infinix Hot 12 has dual speakers. The other speaker is located at the top right where your phone and ear meet while on a phone call. The sound it’s alright. The back of Infinix Hot 12i has three cameras and a flash LED light on the right side of the camera sensors. The front-facing camera also has an LED light which doesn’t come on for notifications.

Performance

Powering the Infinix Hot 12 is the MediaTek Helio G85 processor which is a two-year-old (2020) gaming processor. This is a capable budget gaming processor that offers sustained performance with it and smoother gameplay. For multitasking, this comes in 6GB RAM or 4GB RAM with memory fusion. You can expand the RAM up to 3GB RAM. When it comes to using apps like WhatsApp, Instagram, and TikTok it will run those apps easily.

For the Android operating system, Infinix Hot 12 runs Android 12. It does have ads and bloats which are annoying, but luckily you can’t disable or remove them. Typical for XOS, and this one runs XOS 10.6. Under the battery department, the Infinix Hot 12 comes with a Li-Ion 5000 mAh, non-removable battery, and it will last the entire day. Using its included 18W fast charger it will take about an hour and a half to charge this phone.

Display

The display of the Infinix Hot 12 is at 6.82 inches, 111.7 cm2 (~84.5% screen-to-body ratio) but it doesn’t feel big when you hold it. It’s an IPS LCD panel with a resolution of 720 x 1612 pixels and it has a refresh rate of 90 Hz and it touch sampling rate of 180 Hz. High refresh rates make for smooth scrolling on this and any smartphone. The colors look good on this display, but with this smartphone outdoors, it might be a struggle under direct phone lights. Nonetheless using this display to consume media is good.

Cameras

Moving to the cameras of the Infinix Hot 12, the front-facing camera has an 8 MP sensor. Its photos are okay and portrait shots are decent as well. Moving to the rear cameras, it has a 13 MP, f/1.8, (wide), AF + 2 MP + VGA camera. Photos were taken with the main camera looking descent. Portrait shots look amazing with good details. It can shoot up to 2k and [email protected] videos.

Our take

The Infinix Hot 12 is a fun and fast smartphone at an affordable price. It has a 6.82-inch display with a refresh rate of 90 Hz, a 5,000 mAh battery, dual stereo speakers, and it’s running Android 12 out of the box. The build quality of the Infinix Hot 12 is good, the processor is okay, it has a large 5000 mAh battery that will last the entire day, and it’s running Android 12. On the other hand, if you are okay with the 720p display, even though looks good and has a 90 Hz refresh would put some people off. The display is also not that bright. The cameras can take good pictures in good lighting conditions. But it isn’t going to blow you away. Also, the charging time of more than an hour and 42 minutes is a bit too long for 2022 standards.

Infinix Hot 12 FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

  1. How much is the Infinix Hot 12? – The base approximate price of the Infinix Hot 12 was around 19,500 in Kenya.
  2. When was the Hot 12 released? – The official release date is 2022, April 26.
  3. Does Infinix Hot 12 have 5G? – No, it does not support 5G
  4. Is the Infinix Hot 12 waterproof? – No, it is not waterproof.
  5. Does Infinix Hot 12 support fast charge? – Yes, it supports fast charging. But, it does not support wireless charging.
  6. Does the Infinix Hot 12 have Google services? – Yes, it supports the services of the Google Play Store, Gmail, youtube, etc.
  7. How many cameras does the Infinix Hot 12 have? – There is a Triple main camera and a single selfie camera.

Nice 90Hz display

Though slightly inferior to what we have now been accustomed to, it generally is a great display. Here, you also get a 90Hz refresh rate. Immerse yourself in the large 6.56-inch Infinity-U Display of Oppo A76. This IPS LCD has but a 720 x 1612 resolution and brightness levels with a maximum of 480 nits. You can comfortably (kinda) use this phone outside. Overall this is a noteworthy display thanks to a full-frontal glass, edge-to-edge screen. Buy mostly 90Hz. The tiny dot at the top left corner is where its selfie camera can be found. I believe the name for it is a punch-hole. It is however only fair to mention that a 720 x 1612 pixels resolution really isn’t the best three out there.

Performance

For the performance of Oppo A76 which is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 4G (6 nm) chipset backed by 6GB RAM. The performance will be absolutely fine straight away. And with ColorOS 11.1 experience seems pretty smooth on the whole. As for storage, where you get but one to pick which is 128 GB (UFS 2.1). The good news is that you also got a separate slot for microSD memory cards up to 1TB. On the security side as well, it’s an edge-mounted fingerprint sensor built into that power button right.

Fixing our attention now to the software department of Oppo A76 is ColorOS 11.1 which is based on Android 11. There are tons of customization options here where you can change icon styles, app layout, fingerprint style, change font, and colors. There’s also an app drawer option in the settings and you can easily adjust the navigation buttons the way you want them to be arranged. As for the main cameras, there is a 13 MP, f/2.2, 26mm (wide), 1/3.06″, 1.12µm, PDAF main and a secondary 2 MP, f/2.4, (depth). The camera features present here are LED flash, HDR, and panorama just to mention a few.

Cameras

Design-wise these would appear to be some of the best cameras in this price bracket. But performance-wise the case is different. Save for the fact that it shoots [email protected] with both main and selfie shooters, the Oppo A76 does not have so much more to showcase. But at least its selfie camera takes some nice shots, to be honest. Say cheese while taking selfies with the 8 MP wide camera lens, will you? Video recording with it is also [email protected]

Battery

Since Qualcomm SM6225 Snapdragon 680 4G (6 nm) chipset is energy efficient, the battery while 5,000 mAh battery of Oppo A76  is more than you actually imagine it to be. It should certainly see you through a full day on a single charge. And when the phone is fully drained, you’ve got 33W wired charging support here.

Before you buy Oppo A76

The price of Infinix Smart 6 Plus in Kenya is 13,200. Announced on July 29th, 2022, the Infinix Smart 6 Plus is a budget smartphone with excellent features and benefits that will grab your attention. It has a 5MP front camera for taking selfies and doing video calls. At the back, the device packs 8MP+0.3MP dual cameras and features a Dual-LED flash to capture images and videos in low light. The Infinix Smart 6 HD is powered by a 5,000 mAh battery.

It is silently efficient, with a RAM of 2GB and 32GB internal memory that enables smooth operations of the device. A large 6.82-inch screen with 720 x 1600 pixels dominates the front of the Infinix Smart 6 Plus, assuring the user of great experiences as they communicate, consume content, and capture life moments on the device. The Infinix Smart 6 Plus is available in Tranquil Sea Blue and Miracle Black. Get your Infinix Smart 6 Plus today at Phoneplace Kenya.

The Design and Build of the Infinix Smart 6 Plus

The edges are smooth and wonderfully rounded to appeal to the eye and actual touch and feel in your grasp. The water drop notch on the HD display was designed to ensure the front camera was not obstructed by the glass while appealing to the eye when using the touch screen display. At the back, the slightly protruding quad-pack camera deck stands out on an otherwise flat surface. The designers got it right by positioning the power button, volume buttons on the right, and a fingerprint scanner at the back.

Connectivity

The edges are smooth and wonderfully rounded to appeal to the eye and actual touch and feel in your grasp. The water drop notch on the HD display was designed to ensure the front camera was not obstructed by the glass while appealing to the eye when using the touch screen display. At the back, the slightly protruding quad-pack camera deck stands out on an otherwise flat surface. The designers got it right by positioning the power button, volume buttons on the right, and a fingerprint scanner at the back.

Display

The device is fitted with a 6.82-inch HD+ Display screen. The water droop sunlight display is bright and does not compromise image quality, with a resolution of 720×1600 pixels. You will enjoy your videos and images as you enjoy using the Infinix Smart 6 HD. At 500nits peak brightness, your visual experience will be pleasing and memorable.

Camera

Infinix Smart 6 HD has a 5MP front camera and 8MP+0.3MP MAIN camera at the rear. The selfie camera is strategically placed at the water-drop notch to ensure the unobstructed taking of selfie shots and communication through video calls. It captures 720p videos at 30fps. A single LED flash enables the taking of snaps even in dim or poor lighting conditions. A dual-LED FLASH at the back of the device supports the 8MP+0.3MP (depth) dual camera set up to capture 1080p videos at 30fps.

Performance and Battery

On performance, the Infinix Smart 6 Plus runs smoothly on its 2 GB RAM and 32GB ROM, which fit perfectly with the Android 12 (Go Edition) operating system. The handset is powered by an Octa-core (4×2.0 GHz Cortex-A53 & 4×1.5 GHz Cortex-A53) CPU, MediaTek MT6762G Helio G25 (12 nm) Chipset, and PowerVR GE8320. It is not one of the strongest and fastest processing units but you will be able to surf the internet as fast as possible, download and upload content, multi-task and play low to mid-setting games without lags. For an average user, the Infinix 6 Plus is worth the price as it will get the job done for you without much fuss, hence value for money.

description:
Nokia C21 in Kenya

The Nokia C21 has a recommended price of 12,000 shillings in Kenya. It features a 6.52 inches display and Unisoc SC9863A chipset with IMG8322 GPU. The phone also comes with a single 8 MP rear camera and a 5 MP front camera for selfies. This C21 runs on Android 11 (Go edition), and a 3000 mAh battery powers all this. Buy the Nokia C21 in Kenya for 12,000 shillings at Phoneplace. It is available in colors Dark Blue, and Warm Gray.

Nokia C21 specs and price in Kenya

Price Ksh. 12,000
Display 6.52 inches, IPS LCD
Processor Unisoc SC9863A (28nm)
Sim Card Dual SIM
Connectivity GSM / HSPA / LTE
OS Android 11 (Go edition)
RAM 2GB
ROM 32GB
Card Slot microSDXC
Camera 8 MP
Selfie 5 MP
3.5mm jack Yes
USB Port Micro USB 2.0
Fingerprint Yes
Battery Li-Po 3000 mAh
Charging 5W charging
Colors Sand, Dark Blue

Design and display

The Nokia C21 is a budget phone which is definitely evident considering its design. This phone is made of plastic but with an aluminum frame. It has a minimal and simplistic design. Its back panel features a black, circular module that houses its main camera and a flash. The module is more subtle on the Warm Gray version than on the Dark Blue, which are the two color options of this phone. At the top is a 3.5 mm jack, the bottom features a micro USB port, and there is a speaker on the back of the phone which is odd. This phone measures 169.9 x 77.9 x 8.8 mm and weighs about 195 g (6.88 oz) grams.

The front panel on the other hand features is large 6.52 inches, 102.6 cm2 (~77.5% screen-to-body ratio) display which seems to be a key selling point of the phone. Not that it is the best of its class, for it has a 720 x 1600 pixels resolution. But that it is a large display suitable for the consumption of media. As in watching videos, social media, gaming, and the likes. This display is also fairly bright for the price at 269 PPI density. It must also be remembered that this is an IPS LCD panel. Furthermore, for the build of the Nokia C1 smartphone, you get a Single SIM (Nano-SIM) or Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by) smartphone with up to HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE Cat4 150/50 Mbps of 4G speeds.

Platform and performance

Android 11 (Go edition) is a lightning-speed OS built for smartphones with less than 2 GB of RAM. It is what powers the Nokia C21 seeing that it comes with 2GB of RAM and 32GB of expandable internal storage. The microSDXC for storage expansion has a dedicated slot which means you won’t have to do away with one SIM card in order to utilize this feature. The phone is also available in 32GB 3GB RAM, 64GB 3GB RAM memory eMMC 5.1 opinions. Performance-wise this phone has an entry-level Unisoc SC9863A (28nm) chipset, and an Octa-core (4×1.6 GHz Cortex-A55 & 4×1.2 GHz Cortex-A55) CPU, and an IMG8322 GPU. Not so much to say here is there? Buy for a chipset that was announced on November 27, 2018, and is manufactured using a 28-nanometer process technology, this phone holds up just fine. It also has a 3000 mAh, removable battery that should last up to 2 days of usage given the level at which it performs.

Other features

The Nokia C21 smartphone also features an 8 MP main camera, a 5 MP selfie camera, a Fingerprint (rear-mounted), and it can shoot videos up to [email protected] quality. As far as connectivity features are concerned, we are looking at Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, hotspot, Bluetooth 4.2, A2DP, GPS with A-GPS, FM Radio, and a micro USB 2.0 port which is a bummer.

Nokia C21 FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

  1. When was Nokia C1 released? – The official release date is 2022, February 28.
  2. How big is the display of the Nokia C1? – The screen size of the Nokia C21 is 6.52″ inches.

description:
Huawei Nova 9

Huawei Nova 9 price in Kenya is Ksh 57,500. The Nova 9 phone features 6.6 inches OLED display with a resolution of 1228 x 2700 pixels. The phone has a triple-camera setup that consists of 50 MP + 8 MP + 2 MP + 2 MP and a 32MP camera for selfies. It runs on the Snapdragon 778G 4G processor with Adreno 642L GPU. It has 8 GB RAM, 128GB storage and runs on EMUI 12. The phone is available in Starry Blue, Black, Green, and Violet colors and is powered by a 4300mAh, non-removable. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Huawei Nova 9 specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh 57,500
Display 6.57 inches, 120Hz, OLED
Processor Qualcomm SM7325 Snapdragon 778G 4G (6 nm)
Sim Card Hybrid Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by)
Connectivity 4G
Operating System HarmonyOS 2.0 (China), EMUI 12 (Europe), no Google Play Services
RAM 8GB
Internal Storage 128GB, 256GB
Card Slot up to 256 GB (dedicated slot)
Rear Camera 50 MP + 8 MP + 2 MP + 2 MP
Front Camera 32 MP
3.5mm Jack No
USB USB Type-C 2.0
Sensors Accelerometer, proximity, compass
Battery 4300 mAh
Colors Starry Blue, Black, Green, Violet

New Design

The Huawei nova 9 has a premium feel and unique looks. At least as far as the back is concerned. But its glossy plastic frame is a bit of a fingerprint magnet. Other than that, the back is made of glass and in Kenya, you can get it in Starry Blue, Black, Green, or Violet. This phone feels great in the hand especially since it weighs just 175 grams. It’s one of the lightest phones of this size. Both its front and back have an aggressive curve. Generally, this design is great, striking, and head-turning. Adding Gorilla Glass protection for more durability would have carried the day away. The nova 9 has a single downward-facing speaker. It’s decently loud, and it sounds clean as long as you don’t turn up the volume too much.

Cameras

There are four cameras on the back of the Huawei nova 9 with a 50 MP, f/1.9, 23mm (wide), PDAF main sensor. Present here also is an 8 MP, f/2.2, (ultrawide), 2 MP, f/2.4, (depth) and 2 MP, f/2.4, (macro) . When it came to daylight photos, you will get okay results. Except for a few outliers, the photos are all sharp with good dynamic range. Generally, these photos are not very competitive for the price point. Unless you are buying this one for its 32-megapixel selfie camera that snaps some pretty good selfies.

They had plenty of fine detail, a wide dynamic range, and natural colors. The subject’s face will always be well exposed too. The nova 9 records videos up to 4k at 30 FPS with both the main and ultra cameras. The main cameras footage has an interesting low contrast look which helps for the nice wide dynamic range. Stabilization is impressive. And no matter if you’re running or walking, the software evens out every vibration.

Performance

With the Li-Po 4,300 mAh, non-removable battery, the nova 9 gets an average score on battery life tests of 96 hours. To be frank, its battery life isn’t at par with the competition. But the chipset it uses is less power-hungry. Speaking of which, Huawei nova 9 sports the Qualcomm SM7325 Snapdragon 778G 4G and 8GB RAM. The lack of 5G on this phone, isn’t much of a loss since 5G isn’t yet rolled in Kenya. There are some neat productivity and connectivity options on EMUI.

Like the device plus feature. It offers easy connection and file sharing with your MatePad or MateBook. And multi-screen setup mirrors the phone on your tablet or notebook for an uninterrupted workflow. But hey there is a disclaimer here. There are no Google mobile services here. So make sure that you know what that limitation entails.

Probably the thing to miss most here is Google play. You can use Huawei’s app store. Otherwise, you can also sideload the apps through APKs and the search function can directly find the APKs online for you. This phone comes with these storage options: 128GB 8GB RAM, and 256GB 8GB RAM. It is not expandable not even via NM (Nano Memory). Its GPU is Adreno 642L depending on the region you buy it.

OLED Display

The 6.5-inch OLED panel of Huawei nova 9 has a 120 Hertz fresh rate, HDR 10 support, and a full HD resolution. It scores 433 nits in manual mode and a max of 600 in auto. You’ll have no issues with it on a sunny day. The high refresh rate control is simple and most effective. It features three settings – dynamic, high and standard. Dynamic, and high act pretty much the same while the standard-setting keeps the screen at 60 Hertz. The system will also limit the refresh rate to 60 Hertz when watching full-screen videos.

description:
vivo V23e

The Vivo V23e price in Kenya is Ksh 32,500 shillings. The Vivo V23e features a 6.44 inches display, Android 11, and Mediatek Helio G96 (12 nm) chipset. It also comes with a 64 MP camera and a 4,050 mAh battery. The phone comes in colors Black and Aurora. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

vivo V23e specs & price in Kenya

Price in Kenya   Ksh. 32,500
Camera 64MP + 8MP + 2MP
Selfie  44 MP
Display  6.4 inches
Storage  128GB
Ram  8GB
Chipset Mediatek Helio G96 (12 nm)
Battery  Li-Po 4,050 mAh

Design

vivo V23e is one of the lightest smartphones in 2022. And not only light, but it’s also slim. This is an easy smartphone to hold, it’s lightweight and it doesn’t attract fingerprints, which is awesome. The rear of this smartphone is made from glass, the sides are made from plastic and the front doesn’t have gorilla glass protection. By the way inside its box is the SIM ejector tool, warranty card, Silicon case, earphones, a 3.5 mm audio jack to USB type C adapter, a USB type C cable, and a 44W fast charger.

To the external features, the v23e comes with two microphones. One is at the top while the order is at the bottom. It has a hybrid SIM and memory tray means you can either use two SIM cards or one SIM card and a memory card. It has a mono speaker. On the right side is where the volume keys and power button are located. The fingerprints scanner on this smartphone is located underneath its display. Switching to the rear the phone comes with three cameras. There’s also a flashlight by the side of the camera.

Display

On the front, which is the display of the Vivo V23e, you’ll find a notch with two selfie cameras that isn’t too obtrusive (Hey Siri!). It also hides proper proximity and a light sensor which are better than virtual alternatives. There’s an optical under-display fingerprint reader, which is snappy and reliable. As for the display itself, Vivo V23e has a 6.44 inches AMOLED panel. The phone supports HDR 10 Plus and HLG and has the highest possible wide Vine L1DRM certification for higher streaming resolutions. And while it handles an auto-refresh rate option, it’s not reliable. So you should stick to either 90Hz or the standard 60 Hz. This one has an 83.8% screen-to-body ratio.

Platform

When it comes to its software, Vivo V23e runs on an Android 11 with Funtouch 11.1. This can be described as a pretty lightweight OS that is neat and almost bloatware-free. Almost! Actually, it is very quiet to the stock Android experience. But of course, it has a lot of customization options. Otherwise, it would just be pure Android 11. You can customize your charging animation, or even the face unlock animation.

There is also have Ultra Game Mode for an improved gaming experience. vivo V23e comes with 8GB RAM and 128 GB of internal storage. All regions have 8 GB of RAM since it is the only version available globally. That RAM Extension feature uses memory from 128GB to increase the RAM capacity by 4 gigabytes. This just helps the device run more smoothly. This phone is powered by the Mediatek Helio G96 (12 nm) processor which should be an upgrade to the G95. Performance-wise the phone does a decent job. The thermals are respectable too.

Cameras

As far as cameras go, the Vivo V23e really shines in the selfie department with the same setup as on the V23 Pro. You get a 50-megapixel main camera with auto-focus, an 8 MP, f/2.2, 120˚, 16mm (ultrawide), 1/4.0″, 1.12µm, and two dual tones LEDs that are hidden in the corners of the frame. Selfies are captured at 12.5 megapixels by default. Shots look fantastic! The colors were natural and the background had pleasant bokeh thanks to its dual 50 MP, f/1.8, (wide) AF.  This one does not have the secondary 8 MP, f/2.3, 105˚ (ultrawide) selfie shooter like the Vivo v23 5G smartphone does – check it out.

4K videos from the main front camera are stunning. The autofocus works well and doesn’t hurt either. With EIS off footage is decently steady, but if you’re willing to shoot in Full HD and accept a bit of crop, you can switch it on enjoy even smoother videos. There’s EIS on both the main and Ultrawide cameras in the back. There’s also a super stabilization mode on the main camera that smooths out the video further.

Battery

Its Li-Po 4050 mAh battery is respectable. And the phone makes good use of its capacity with 101 hours on endurance tests. The 44W flash charge of the V23e comes with also works well. You can charge the phone from dead to 69% in half an hour. For a full charge, you will need just over an hour, which is quite good too.

description:
vivo V23 5G

The vivo V23 5G price in Kenya is Ksh 59,900 shillings. The vivo V23 5G features a 6.44 inches display, Android 12, and MediaTek Dimensity 920 5G (6 nm) chipset. It also comes with a 64 MP camera and a 4200 mAh battery. The phone comes in colors Sunshine Gold andStardust Black. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

vivo V23 5G specs & price in Kenya

Price in Kenya   Ksh. 59,900
Camera 64MP + 8MP + 2MP
Selfie  44 MP

Ram  8GB

Design and build

The Vivo V23 5G has a flat-screen and flat edge. Its camera area design is the same as on the Pro model. Looks like Vivo has taken inspiration from Samsung and Apple, mixing these design elements altogether with the phone’s signature color – sunshine gold. The phone is also available in Stardust Black. This sunshine gold color is a result of reactive dye that changes when exposed to sunlight or other UV lights. The paint can take from 30 seconds to a couple of minutes for the color to change from golden to bluish-green.

Due to its curved sides, this one can slip out of your hand more easily. But the flatter aluminum frame of the V23 offers better grip even without using the case so you get to enjoy the soft sandy feel of the fluoride glass on the back. The buttons on this phone have a little click. There is a single bottom-firing speaker on the Vivo V23 5G and no headphone jack or FM radio support either. It’s a bit of a letdown for a phone at this price.

Cameras

As far as cameras go, the Vivo V23 5G really shines in the selfie department with the same setup as on the V23 Pro. You get a 50-megapixel main camera with auto-focus, an 8 MP, f/2.2, 120˚, 16mm (ultrawide), 1/4.0″, 1.12µm, and two dual tones LEDs that are hidden in the corners of the frame. Selfies are captured at 12.5 megapixels by default. Shots look fantastic! The colors were natural and the background had pleasant bokeh thanks to its dual 50 MP, f/2.0, (wide), AF and 8 MP, f/2.3, 105˚ (ultrawide) selfie shooter.

4K videos from the main front camera are stunning. The autofocus works well and doesn’t hurt either. With EIS off footage is decently steady, but if you’re willing to shoot in Full HD and accept a bit of crop, you can switch it on enjoy even smoother videos. There’s EIS on both the main and Ultrawide cameras in the back. There’s also a super stabilization mode on the main camera that smooths out the video further.

Performance

The Vivo V23 5G has a MediaTek Dimensity 920 5G (6 nm) chipset, and eight or 12 GB of RAM. For reference, its closest Snapdragon competitors are the Snapdragon 860 and the 778G. While they beat the phone in terms of raw performance, this phone holds its own as an excellent mid-range performer. Even with torture testing, the phone rarely gets too hot.

Theming the phone is Funtouch 12 on top of Android 12. And you will see some new Android 12 features here and there. For example, Google’s grain notification dot, which indicates when the camera or microphone is in use and the more bouncy animations. System menus are tailored for single-handed use. And its default selection of widgets is more intuitive than before. Of course, you also have a dedicated ultra game mode that helps you mitigate disturbances during games.

Display

On the front, which is the display of the Vivo V23 5G, you’ll find a notch with two selfie cameras that isn’t too obtrusive (Hey Siri!). It also hides proper proximity and a light sensor which are better than virtual alternatives. Now this display is covered by Schott Xensation Up glass. This is a step down from the V23 Pro Schott Xensation Alpha which is said to rival Gorilla Glass Victus.

There’s an optical under-display fingerprint reader, which is snappy and reliable. As for the display itself, Vivo V23 5G has a 6.44 inches AMOLED panel. The phone supports HDR 10 Plus and HLG and has the highest possible wide Vine L1DRM certification for higher streaming resolutions. And while it handles an auto-refresh rate option, it’s not reliable. So you should stick to either 90Hz or the standard 60 Hz.

Battery

Its Li-Po 4200 mAh battery is respectable. And the phone makes good use of its capacity with 103 hours on endurance tests. The 44W flash charge of the V23 5G comes with also works well. You can charge the phone from dead to 60% in half an hour. For a full charge, you will need just over an hour, which is quite good too.

Redmi Watch 2 Lite in Kenya

It is available in various colors such as Black, Blue, and Ivory.

The smartwatch is fueled with a Non-removable Li-Ion 262 mAh battery while the sensors include an Accelerometer, heart rate, gyro, compass, and SpO2. The device is built with a plastic back and plastic frame. The device features IM and Email facilities and It runs on a proprietary operating system. It also comes with A-GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, BDS while there is no NFC, Radio, USB, and 3.5mm jack

description:
Realme 9i

The Realme 9i price in Kenya is Ksh 23,000. The Realme 9i has a 6.6-inch Full HD+ LCD screen with a 90Hz variable refresh rate, a 90.8% screen-to-body ratio, and has a Side-mounted fingerprint sensor. It runs on the latest Snapdragon 680 6nm processor with up to 6GB of RAM + up to 5GB Virtual RAM, 128GB UFS 2.1 storage, and is based on Android 11 with realme UI 2.0, which is upgradable to Android 12 with realme UI 3.0.

It has a triple rear camera setup where a 50-megapixel primary camera along with a 2-megapixel B&W portrait sensor, a 2-megapixel sensor for 4cm macro shots, and on the front side has a 16-megapixel punch-hole front-facing-camera. The phone has dedicated dual SIM and microSD card slots, advanced dual stereo speakers, and is powered by a 5000mAh battery that supports 33W fast charging. The realme 9i will be available in Blue Quartz & Black Quartz colors.

Realme 9i price and specs in Kenya

Price in Kenya : Ksh 23,000
Display : 6.6 inches
Processor : Snapdragon 680
OS : Android 11, Realme UI 2.0
RAM : 6GB
Colors : Blue Quartz & Black Quartz
Storage : 128GB
Dimension : 164.4 x 75.7 x 8.4 mm
Main Camera : 50 MP + 2 MP + 2 MP
Selfie Camera : 16 MP
Battery : 5000 mAh
Build : Glass front, plastic back, plastic frame
SIM Type : Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by)
Build Features : Fingerprint (rear-mounted), accelerometer, proximity, compass

Design

The Realme 9i comes with a distinctive camera island. It is available in colors Black, and Blue. Maybe that’s because the back and frame are made of plastic (Dragontrail Pro) are not very slippery. The phone sides are flat all around which makes the 9i feel sharp along the edges. The power and volume keys are easy to reach and the power key doubles as a side-mounted fingerprint reader. It’s fast and reliable. You can use a firm touch, which means you’ll need to press the key, release it, and then touch the scanner again. The 9i has a headphones jack and stereo speakers next to it. It scores very good loudness on tests. Overall, the music sounds quite impressive.

90Hz Display

On the front, you’ll find a punch hole in the upper left corner and not-so-slim bezzles. Especially the one on the bottom. Then Realme 9i has a 6.6 inch IPS LCD panel with a 90 Hertz refresh rate. You can set the refresh rate to 60 Hertz or choose the granular auto-refresh rate. Unfortunately, games will be stuck at 60 Hertz. This LCD has a Full HD resolution, nice contrast, and good levels of brightness with a max of 480 nits. You can comfortably (kinda) use this phone outside. Color accuracy isn’t the best though since whites and grays have a bluish tint. There is Dragontrail Pro Glass protection present on this display.

Cameras

Let us chat cameras of the Realme 9i and it boasts a 50 MP, f/1.8, 26mm (wide), 1/2.76″, 0.64µm, PDAF main camera, accompanied by a 2 MP, f/2.4, (macro) camera and 2 MP, f/2.4, (depth) sensor. Yeah, no ultrawide shooter here. And the selfie camera is a 16 MP, f/2.0, (wide) shooter. You will get good-looking photos from the rare camera with a good dynamic range. By virtue of its 50-megapixel main camera, you can activate the 50-megapixel mode to take the same pixel photos. You will get higher-resolution photos this way. It has a super night mode which does great to give you better low light images with less noise. This phone actually takes sharp photos with good skin tones, put on portrait and normal modes.

Performance

The Realme 9i has a Qualcomm SM6225 Snapdragon 680 4G (6 nm) chipset. This one is great for day-to-day tasks and it is also pretty good with some games. The phone launches with Android 11, and Realme UI 2.0 out of the box. Upon upgrade, it will have Android 12, Realme UI 3.0. These latter Android version features are mostly under the hood. There’s a private dashboard where you can see all your permissions and user data settings.

You can also choose the accuracy of your location. And you get a green dot in the corner of the display when your mic is turned on. The Realme 9i has Realme UI 3.0. It’s a colorful yet snapping UI with a lot of customization options. You can change everything from accent colors to icons, to the shapes of the quick toggles. It also provides good multitasking features like the smart sidebar which allows shortcuts to your favorite apps. And the flexible windows feature opens up apps in a floating window.

Battery

Thanks to its Li-Po 5000 mAh, non-removable battery, the Realme 9i gets an excellent 134 hours of endurance of battery life. That’s certainly enough to overtake most competitors. The 9 Pro uses the 33W dart charger. While it’s not as fast as chargers from competing brands, it gets the phone a respectable 0 to 52% charge in 30 minutes and a full charge in an hour and 14 minutes.

description:
Huawei P50 Pro 

Huawei P50 Pro price in Kenya is Ksh 129,500. The P50 Pro phone features 6.6 inches OLED display with a resolution of 1228 x 2700 pixels. The phone has a triple-camera setup that consists of 50 MP + 64 MP + 13 MP + 40 MP and a 13MP camera for selfies. It runs on the Snapdragon 888 4G processor with Adreno 660 GPU. It has 8 GB RAM, 128GB storage and runs on EMUI 12. The phone is available in Golden Black, Cocoa Gold, Pearl White, and Charm Pink colors and is powered by a 4360mAh, non-removable. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

 Huawei P50 Pro specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh 129,500
Display 6.6 inches, 120Hz, OLED
Processor Snapdragon 888 4G
Sim Card Hybrid Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by)
Connectivity 4G
Operating System HarmonyOS 2.0 (China), EMUI 12 (Europe), no Google Play Services
RAM 8GB, 12GB
Internal Storage 128GB, 256GB, 512GB
Card Slot up to 256 GB (dedicated slot)
Rear Camera 50 MP + 64 MP + 13 MP + 40 MP
Front Camera 13 MP
3.5mm Jack No
USB USB Type-C 3.1
Sensors Accelerometer, proximity, compass
Battery 4360 mAh
Colors Golden Black, Cocoa Gold, Pearl White, Charm Pink

Build and design

The Huawei P50 Pro like many high-end devices brings a curvy elegant glass design paired with a metal frame. The most unique design element here is the camera bump. It is divided into two symmetrical circles. The phone also feels quite thin and weighs less than 200 grams. It’s easy to hold in one hand. Plus the P50 Pro is IP68 rated against water and dust. When it comes to audio, the Huawei P50 Pro brings a pair of stereo speakers, which is an upgrade over the Huawei P40 Pro‘s single speaker setup. Its sound is rich, clean, and nicely balanced with pretty good bass.

Cameras

What is the big deal about the cameras of the Huawei P50 Pro? Well, there’s a 50 MP, f/1.8, 23mm (wide), PDAF, Laser AF, OIS main camera, a 64 MP, f/3.5, 90mm (periscope telephoto), PDAF, OIS, 3.5x optical zoom, 7x lossless zoom, a 13 MP, f/2.2, 13mm (ultrawide), AF and a 40 MP, f/1.6, 23mm (B/W), AF. During the day, the main camera takes outstanding 12.5-megapixel photos. Images look balanced and natural with true-to-life colors and just the right amount of sharpening. The main camera is also the primary portrait shooter and its results are brilliant.

The monochrome camera also captures photos in 12.5 megapixels to keep things consistent. Its black and white photos are stunning. Its ultra-wide camera is quite capable during the day with photos that are sharp and detailed enough. P50 Pro’s telephoto camera provides 3.5 times optical zoom. And these 16-megapixel photos are exceptional. The cameras of this phone are compared to those of Galaxy S22 Ultra 5G by Samsung.

Selfies are taken with a 13 MP, f/2.4, (wide), AF front-facing camera which has a wide field of view in the native wide-angle mode. It takes some of the best selfies we’ve reviewed on a phone. They’re incredibly sharp and detailed with accurate colors, super contrast, and great dynamic range. Also, the Huawei P50 Pro can record video and up to 4k with all of its cameras. And electronic stabilization is always on the main camera’s footage. Video quality from the monochrome camera is outstanding. 4k clips from the ultrawide are good too.

OLED Display

On the front of the P50 Pro is a 6.6 inch curved OLED display. It’s high res with a pixel density of 450 PPI. And there’s a fast 120 Hertz refresh rate too. This high refresh rate smooths out motions like swiping and scrolling. It also dials down to 60 Hertz to save energy when you’re not interacting with the screen. There’s also a fast 300 Hertz touch sampling rate. This means the panel is extra responsive. Most gamers are the ones who will enjoy this touch sampling feature.

Present on this phone also is support for 10-bit color and HDR 10 Plus. Color accuracy is excellent. The panel is also brighter than the previous model the Huawei P40 Pro at over 600 nits when using the manual brightness slider. And this can boost up to 750 nits on auto mode and bright conditions. And you get an under-display optical fingerprint scanner which is quite fast and reliable to wake up and unlock the phone.

Platform

When it comes to chipset performance, the Huawei P50 Pro doesn’t disappoint. It boasts a Qualcomm SM8350 Snapdragon 888 4G (5 nm) just like 2021 flagships. But despite this, with the P50 Pro, you don’t get the 5G modem. So connectivity is limited to 4G networks. The interface of this phone is HarmonyOS 2.0 (China), EMUI 12 (Global), no Google Play Services based on Android 11. The layout overall is familiar to Android users. Except that here you get a separate control panel for various settings. What you’re missing here compared to a typical Android phone are Google services. You’ll get something similar through Huawei’s proprietary package.

Probably the thing to miss most here is Google play. You can use Huawei’s app store. Otherwise, you can also sideload the apps through APKs and the search function can directly find the APKs online for you. This phone comes with these storage options: 128GB 8GB RAM, 256GB 8GB RAM, 512GB 8GB RAM, and 512GB 12GB RAM. It is expandable using NM (Nano Memory), up to 256GB (uses shared SIM slot). Its GPU is Mali-G78 MP24 or Adreno 660 depending on the region you buy it.

Battery

For its battery life, the P50 Pro is a Li-Po 4360 mAh, non-removable battery, which is sizable enough. Unlike some other flagship phones, the P50 Pro ships with a 66W charger in the box. You will be able to charge the phone from 0 to 73% in half an hour. And alternatively, you have support for 50W fast wireless charging too.

Our take

That’s the Huawei P50 Pro. The main benefit you get here is its cameras. There are some of the best we’ve seen on a smartphone yet. Here also there are also nice flagship features like a waterproof build, a curved higher refresh rate OLED, stereo speakers, a high-end chipset, and fast charging. description:
Tecno Spark 9 in Kenya

Tecno Spark 9 is a budget smartphone, expected to be released by the end of July. The device features 6.6 inches, IPS LCD screen with a Refresh Rate of 90Hz. It measures 164.6 x 76 x 9 mm and has a display resolution of 720 x 1600 pixels (~266 ppi density). It will run on Android 12, HIOS 8.6 OS, and be powered by an Octa-Core, Mediatek MT6765V/CB Helio G37 (12 nm) processor. It has 3, 4, and 8G RAM running 64GB and 128GB variants. It packs a 13MP main camera and 8MP selfie front camera. A 5,000mAh non-removable battery powers the entire device, charged through a MicroUSB 2.0 port, which also supports USB On-The-Go (OTG). Tecno Spark 9 will be available on the market in Infinity Black, and Sky Mirror colors. It will retail at Kes 15,500 at Phoneplace Kenya.

Tecno Spark 9 Price, Features, and Specifications

Feature SPECIFICATIONS

Design, Build and Display

Tecno Spark 9 is ergonomically designed with a prominent water drop at the front and a Dual Camera set up at the rear. The body frame and back of the device are made of plastic, while the front is glass. The rounded edges and flat surfaces are typical of all Tecno smartphones. The good finishing makes the Spark 9 appear premium and feel premium, although it’s a typical budget device. It measures 164.6 x 76 x 9 mm. 9mm is quite thick for a smartphone, considering there are devices as thin as 7mm. Anyway, one could argue the Spark 9 is a bug smartphone, considering its dimensions and a 6.6-inch screen.

The 6.6-inch display is made of IPS LCD, with a refresh rate of 90Hz. Not bad for a budget device, considering its resolution is 720 x 1600 pixels, 20:9 ratio (~266 ppi density). Not one of the brightest devices, but it will get the job done when it comes to content consumption via the display and normal use that requires a smooth user interface.

Performance and Battery

Tecno Spark 9 devices are available in 3 variants, in terms of memory space: 3GB RAM 64 GB internal memory capacities, 4GB 64 GB, and 6 RAM 128GB. This memory space is sufficient to enable efficient running of operations and storing of the users’ content. The more the RAM, the better the user experience.

The device runs on Android 12, HIOS 8.6 Operating System. This is the latest Android OS platform with all updates to enable optimal operations and user experience when using the device. A Mediatek MT6765V/CB Helio G37 (12 nm) Chipset runs operations in the background, supported by Octa-core (4×2.3 GHz Cortex-A53 & 4×1.8 GHz Cortex-A53) CPU and PowerVR GE8320. The CPU is powerful and helps to optimize the battery usage of the device.

It is not one of the best devices for playing video games, considering its features and specifications make it a budget phone. For a casual gamer, you can play basic games. For serious gamers, we recommend you go for a device with superior specifications.

In terms of battery, Spark 9 is powered by a 5,000mAh non-removable Li-Po battery. Unfortunately, the device does not come with a fast charger, but ypu can opt to buy one separately. Considering it has a normal Micro USB 2.0 port, you can charge and transfer data using available wired USB chargers.

Sensors and Connectivity.

The device comes with a side-mounted fingerprint scanner. This enables convenient and safe access to the phone. Other sensors include an accelerometer and a Proximity sensor. A-GPS enabled easier navigability, which is important for motorists who need direction.

The device supports network connectivity up to 4G. It supports GSM/HSPA/LTE technologies and  HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE speed. A dual SIM provision enables easy network switching, depending on network connectivity. Wireless connection is enabled through seamless Bluetooth pairing which is support, Wi-Fi connectivity, and Hotspot which enables sharing of Wi-Fi to other devices.

Camera.

The cameras are not one of the strongest points of the device. at the front, the user will capture selfies and enjoy quality video calls using the 8 MP, (wide) camera. It features an LED flash which enables illumination to capture quality images and videos in low light. The front camera’s lens is located at the water drop notch.

At the rear, Tecno Spark 9 packs a Dual Camera set-up. The two cameras comprise a primary 13 MP, f/1.9, 27mm (wide), AF, and a secondary camera (details yet to be confirmed). The autofocus in the rear camera set-up enables quality video and snap capture, with a dual LED, HDR, and panorama enabling the users to utilize options based on need and circumstances. The main camera captures 1080p [email protected], which is a standard on modern-day smartphones.

The Samsung Galaxy M23 5G price in Kenya is Ksh 30,000. The Galaxy M23 5G is powered by the Octa-core (2.2 GHz & 1.8 GHz) processor. The phone has 4GB RAM and 128 GB of internal storage which is expandable using microSDXC. The Galaxy M23 5G runs on Android 12 and all this is powered by a 5000 mAh battery. It also has a triple rear camera setup where a 50 MP primary camera with OIS along with an 8 MP ultra-wide camera, 2MP depth, and an 8 MP front-facing camera. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Samsung Galaxy M23 5G specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh 30,000
Display 6.6 -inch HD+, TFT
Processor Qualcomm SM7225 Snapdragon 750G 5G (8 nm)
Sim  Dual SIM

Battery Li-Po 5000 mAh
Colors Deep Green, Light Blue

Design

Now the Samsung Galaxy M23 5G smartphone looks amazing whether in Deep Green, or Light Blue. It’s nice to see some of those Samsung design hues coming down to the lower-end models. Just have our very simple triple lens set up here. You have a matte plastic finish on the back here. There is also plastic on the sides here. On the bottom, you have a headphone jack. Love to see that and the mic also. You have a type C port capable of 25W fast charging. There is also a single speaker on the right side. The volume rockers are at the top. And one of our favorites is the side-mounted fingerprint sensor. And on the top, we have another mic.

Display

Now one downside of the Samsung Galaxy M23 5G should you decide to grab it is the fact you get a TFT screen rather than an AMOLED display. Well, it still seems reasonably bright in everything, but you don’t get those same punchy colors. You don’t get the same sharp contrast. And because it’s not an OLED, you don’t get an always-on-display. Still, this 6.6 -inch panel is fine at 1080 x 2408 pixels. The FHD resolution keeps things pretty sharp. And yeah, this is not a 90 Hertz display. To put it simply, if you are okay with 6.6 inches, TFT, 1080 x 2408 pixels, 20:9 ratio (~400 PPI density) display then look no further than Galaxy M23 5G.

Cameras

When you flip the Samsung Galaxy M23 5G smartphone around you can’t miss the camera module on the back. The same constitutes a 50 MP, f/1.8, 26mm (wide), PDAF, 8 MP, f/2.2, (ultrawide), 1/4″, 1.12µm, and a 2 MP, f/2.4, (depth) lens. But really the main focus here, pun intended, is on that main sensor. With 50 megapixels you should expect detailed shots. As far as videos go, this phone can shoot up to [email protected] It has an 8 MP, f/2.2, (wide) selfie camera that shoots okay pics. The best use case for this selfie camera would be video calls and stuff like that. In the last place, some of the camera features of Galaxy M23 5G are LED flash, panorama, and HDR. 

Android 12, One UI 4

What you have got running the Samsung Galaxy M23 5G is Android 12, One UI 4.1 launcher. One UI just brings the best of Android 12 here. For instance, the privacy features are present and correct. You can fast toggle the camera and microphone access for all apps. And when you load up an app that uses the camera or the mic, you’ll get a little indicator at the top corner. You’ve got great customization in one UI. For example, you change the wallpaper and everything as usual, but you’ll also see the new color palette option as well. This can actually change up the theme and colors based on the wallpaper you’ve got installed at the time.

Battery

Finally, the Samsung Galaxy M23 5G comes with a massive 5,000 mAh battery. We best describe its performance as the power that keeps you going all day long. Seriously though, isn’t 5000 mAh so generous? We find it is. And should you start running low, plugin, and power up with 25W Fast Charging? A 2.0, Type-C 1.0 reversible connector is present here. You also get NFC and 5.0, A2DP, LE with Samsung Galaxy M23 5G.

Before you buy Samsung Galaxy M23 5G

description:
Vivo Y33s in Kenya

The price of Vivo Y33s in Kenya is 25,000 shillings. The Y33s features a 6.58 inches display, Android 11, and Mediatek Helio G80 chipset. It also comes with a 13 MP camera and a 5000 mAh battery. The phone comes in colors Mirror Black and Midday Dream. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Vivo Y33s Specs & price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh. 25,000
Brand vivo
Processor Mediatek Helio G80
Operating System Android 11, Funtouch 11.1
Internal 128GB
RAM 4GB
Rear Camera 13 MP  + 2 MP
Front Camera 8 MP
Display 6.51 inch
Battery 5000 mAh
Charging Fast charging 18W

In the box

So what comes in the box of Vivo Y33s? When you purchase one you also get complete accessories. You get a device itself, a pair of wired earphones, a USB-C cable, and an 18W fast charger. You should also be getting a transparent case in the box.

Design

The Vivo Y33s has a design that is reminiscent of the Vivo v21. This one comes into interesting colors, Mirror Black, and Midday Dream. The latter is the one we think is a more interesting design. It is a mirror. Very much reflective and glossy. So if you’ll be using without the case, be ready to be wiping off those fingerprint smudges. Whereas it looks like glass, it is actually plastic on its rear. Its triple cameras are aligned at the top left side.

This phone has a rather squared or boxy design which feels premium in the hands. Its volume rocker and power button are conventionally placed (RHS) in an easy-to-reach position. The power button also hosts the fingerprint scanner which is very responsive and instantly unlocks the device. You can opt for face unlock if that is your preferred choice. Its headphone jack USB-C port and mono speaker are at the bottom frame while the SIM slot is at the top. The same supports microSD cards.

Cameras

Let us chat cameras of the Vivo Y33s and it boasts a 50 MP, f/1.8, (wide), PDAF main camera, accompanied by a 2 MP, f/2.4, (macro) camera and 2 MP, f/2.4, (depth) sensor. Yeah, no ultrawide shooter here. And the selfie camera is a 16 MP, f/2.0, (wide) shooter. You will get good-looking photos from the rare camera with a good dynamic range.

By virtue of its 50-megapixel main camera, you can activate the 50-megapixel mode to take the same pixel photos. You will get higher-resolution photos this way. It has a super night mode which does great to give you better low light images with less noise. This phone actually takes sharp photos with good skin tones, put on portrait and normal modes.

Display

What you are getting here for display with the Vivo Y33s is 6.58 inches, Fukk HD IPS LCD display with a high pixel density of 401 pixels per inch. It is quite vibrant for an LCD display with this brightness level which makes it fit for use. It has a water drop that houses its 16 MP selfie camera. This is a sharp display suitable for watching media content.

The color temperature of this display can be adjusted under settings. And the three color settings available here are standard, which is default, professional and bright. One thing which this display lacks that we see on a couple of other devices at this price point is a higher than 60Hz refresh rate. Not a deal-breaker since this panel is actually quite responsive.

Performance

Under the hood of Vivo Y33s is a Mediatek MT6769V/CU Helio G80 processor. That is the same processor you will find on the Vivo Y53S which is also available on our website. Be sure to check it out. It is a 12-nanometer processor which is optimized to give good gaming performance. Its benchmark score is higher than what the Samsung Galaxy A22 scores just for context. This phone packs, a 5000 mAh, non-removable battery which can power it through the whole day on a full charge. That is without needing to recharge. Fast battery charging 18W is also supported here.

Platform

When it comes to its software, Vivo Y33s runs on an Android 11 with Funtouch 11.1. This can be described as a pretty lightweight OS that is neat and almost bloatware-free. Almost! Actually, it is very quiet to the stock Android experience. But of course, it has a lot of customization options. Otherwise, it would just be pure Android 11. You can customize your charging animation, or even the face unlock animation.

There is also have Ultra Game Mode for an improved gaming experience. vivo Y33s comes with 4GB RAM and 128 GB of internal storage. Some regions might have 8 GB of RAM. That RAM Extension feature uses memory from 128GB to increase the RAM capacity by 1 gigabyte. This just helps the device run more smoothly.

Our take

The Vivo Y33s, you will notice its slick design and very slim profile. But underneath all of that is the Mediatek MT6769V/CU Helio G80 (12 nm) chipset which this device has 4 GB of RAM, an additional 1 GB RAM by extension, 50-megapixel triple rear camera set up, and an a1080 P display all for less than 30,000 Kenya shillings. This one sort of checks out with the competition. The Vivo Y33s is as powerful as the Vivo Y53s by virtue of the same processor, and again, it has that slick design that will turn heads.

The Samsung Galaxy a03 Core price in Kenya is 11,500 shillings. It has a 6.5 inches display, powered by a Unisoc SC9863A (28nm) chipset, 2 GB of RAM, 32 GB of internal storage, and a 5,000 mAh Battery. Coming to cameras, it has a single-camera system that consists of an 8 MP and a 5 MP front camera for selfies.
