Display

Shortly and very quickly know that Samsung basically refers to the notch wherein lies the selfie camera when it calls the display of Galaxy A03 Core Infinity – V display. This notch has been implemented on a 6.5 inches display panel which makes this one among the most compact smartphones of recent times. Its resolution is 720 x 1600 pixels. Fine although bezels have not been completely done away with here we must agree that a large portion of the display estate has been left for users to enjoy. And giving this phone a notch shows it even further.

Performance

It is an entry-level smartphone the Samsung Galaxy A03 Core. Sp really to lay down too much performance expectations on it would be unfair. For its price in Kenya, this phone does a pretty good job with its Unisoc SC9863A (28nm) chipset. The CPU here is an Octa-core (4×1.6 GHz Cortex-A55 & 4×1.2 GHz Cortex-A55) and the phone comes also with an IMG8322 GPU. Android 11 (Go edition) is the user interface, the course now that it only has 2GB RAM and 32GB storage. Thankfully the 32GB storage can be expanded using a microSDXC. There is a dedicated slot for this feature.

More features

Some other notable features of Samsung Galaxy A03 Core include a main 8 MP, f/2.0, AF, and a 5 MP, f/2.2 selfie camera. For connectivity, you get Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Wi-Fi Direct, hotspot, Bluetooth 4.2, A2DP, and a micro USB 2.0, USB On-The-Go. This immediately reminds me of the Li-Ion 5000 mAh battery it packs. A highlight feature of this one to be honest. It should last at least two days of usage. There is no fingerprint scanner on this phone but an accelerometer, and proximity sensor only. Finally, this Single SIM (Nano-SIM) or Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by) phone has a Plastic back, and plastic frame for its build.

description:
Infinix Zero 5G

The Infinix Zero 5G price in Kenya is around Ksh 32,500. The Zero 5G features a 6.78-inch IPS LCD display with a 120 Hz refresh rate. The phone is powered by MediaTek Dimensity 900 5G SoC with up to 8GB of RAM and 128GB storage. It packs a 5,000mAh battery with support for 33W fast charging technology. Infinix claims that it can offer up to 22 hours of Talktime and 27 days of standby. It runs on XOS 10 and has an Android 11 out of the box. The smartphone sports a single 16MP selfie snapper and a triple camera system at the rear. The rear setup goes by a 48MP main lens, a 13MP secondary lens, and a 2MP sensor. The main sensor has 30X zoom capability. It has a quad-LED flash and dual front flash. . Buy the Infinix Zero 5G in Kenya for 32,500 shillings at Phoneplace. It is available in colors Cosmic Black, Skylight Orange, and Horizon Blue.

Infinix Zero 5G specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh. 32,500
Display 6.78 inches, IPS LCD, 120Hz
Processor MediaTek Dimensity 900 5G (6 nm)
Sim Card Dual SIM
Connectivity GSM / HSPA / LTE / 5G
OS Android 11
RAM 8GB
ROM 128GB
Card Slot microSDXC
Camera 48 MP + 13 MP + 2 MP
Selfie 16MP
3.5mm jack Yes
USB Port USB Type-C 2.0
Fingerprint Side-mounted
Battery Li-Po 5000 mAh
Charging Fast Charging 33W
Colors Black, Orange, Blue

New design

The Infinix Zero 5G has an interesting design. The back is curved and quite glossy, and it slopes up to seamlessly meet the cameras. This finish makes its back panel is a bit of a fingerprint magnet. Although the material may look like glass, the phone is actually made of plastic and it feels like it too. The volume rocker and the fingerprint reader cum power button are on the same side of this phone. The latter is clicky and quite responsive, waking up and unlocking the phone in an instant.

Cameras (with a telephoto)

As for the cameras, on Infinix Zero 5G there’s a 48 MP, f/1.8, 26mm (wide), 1/2.0″, 0.8µm, PDAF, 13 MP, f/2.5, 50mm (telephoto), 1/3.1″, 1.12µm, PDAF, 2x optical zoom and a third 2 MP lens. The main camera captures decent 12-megapixel photos by default. There’s an average amount of detail and fine patterns also get displayed. Shots from the 2X times telephoto are quite different from the main cameras because of the more fine detail and a more pleasant color rendition. Portraits with either the main or the telephoto camera.

Selfies are taken with its 16 MP, f/2.0, (wide), 1/2.76″, 1.12µm front-facing camera. Their detail and colors are on point and the dynamic range isn’t too bad. The selfie camera is usable at night too. Thanks in part to the phone’s dual-LED flash. Videos can be captured at [email protected], and [email protected]/60fps with this phone’s main camera. The videos come out great In terms of detail and dynamic range. Selfies videos are capped at [email protected] which is acceptable. There is electronic stabilization available for your video recording, but you’re limited to 1080p.

Display and Audio

The screen of the Infinix Zero 5G is a 6.78-inch IPS LCD with a 1080 x 2460 resolution and a 120 Hertz refresh rate. The high refresh rate is adaptive, meaning that it can dial down depending on the content on-screen to save power. It makes movement on the screen more fluid. With a pixel density of 388 PPI, this screen looks plenty sharp, but sadly it has no HDR support of any kind. For audio, the Zero 5G has a traditional headphone jack and a single bottom-firing speaker. This speaker scores a good rating on loudness charts. Its sound quality is okay with decent sounding highs.

Performance

Powering Infinix Zero 5G is a MediaTek MT6877 Dimensity 900 5G (6 nm) chipset. It provides solid midrange performance which interestingly outclasses MediaTek G-series chipsets. Oh, and battery life is great too. The Zero 5G has a large Li-Po 5000 mAh, non-removable battery with an endurance rating of 140 hours. Although despite having a decent size 33W adapter, with it, it goes from 0 to 30% in half an hour. The Infinix Zero 5G smartphone comes with 128 GB of storage onboard. This storage is expandable via a micro SD card.

Platform

This phone runs XOS 10 which features extensive customizations. It still is based on Android 11. Besides customization, there is also a tone of extra pre-installed apps too. One difference from stock Android you’ll notice immediately is that the standard notification shade is divided into a separate notification center and a control center. The home screen is really customizable too. You can choose from different swipe actions and even set your own font color. Cool feature right? You also get a dedicated game launcher that lets you tune your gaming experience. Things like an AI assistant, smart connectivity, a system-wide translator, and power-saving controls are also feature available on this 5G phone.

Our take

The Infinix Zero 5G brings a new and fresh look, a large 120 Hertz LCD, a decent chipset with 5G connectivity, and excellent battery life. Plus you get a telephoto lens which is not too common at this price. Save for a not-so-bright display, and kind of slow charging (relative), this is an easy to recommend smartphone. You may also want to check out the Infinix Zero X Pro smartphone.

Infinix Zero 5G FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

  1. When was the Zero 5G released? – The official release date is 2022, February 08.
  2. Does the Infinix Zero 5G support 5G? – Yes, it supports 5G.
  3. What charging options does the Infinix Zero 5G have? – It supports fast charging. But it does not support wireless charging.
  4. Does the Zero 5G give Google services? – Yes, it supports the services of Google Play Store, Gmail, youtube, etc.
  5. How many cameras does the Infinix Zero 5G have? – There is Triple main camera and a single selfie camera.
  6. Is the Zero 5G waterproof? – No, it is not waterproof.

description:
Vivo Y15s

The Vivo Y15s price in Kenya is Ksh 15,800. The Vivo Y12s features a 6.51 inches display, Android 11, and Mediatek Helio P35 chipset. It also comes with a 13 MP + 2MP camera and a 5000 mAh battery. The phone comes in colors Wave Green and Mystic Blue. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Vivo Y15s specs & price in Kenya

Price in Kenya   Ksh. 15,800
Camera 13 MP + 2MP
Selfie  8 MP
Display  6.51 inches
Storage 32GB
Ram  3GB
Chipset Mediatek Helio P35
Battery  Li-Po 5000 mAh

Display

Focusing on the display, Vivo Y15s comes with a big and bright 6.51 inches IPS LCD display panel. Look, dear reader, I cannot even get over the fact that it does not have more than a 60Hz refresh rate. Seriously, Vivo should do better by now. At this price point, completion it offering at least 90Hz refresh rate displays. But moving on, this panel does not disappoint when it comes to the resolution. We see a rather low 720 x 1600 pixels resolution with 270 PPI density. We’re thinking a compromise had to be made. And you will also notice the hole punch wherein the selfie camera lies. This panel has a dew-drop notch wherein the selfie camera hides.

Performance

Okay, the chipset Vivo Y15s comes with is a rather dated Mediatek MT6765 Helio P35 (12nm) chip. MediaTek Helio P35 enables beautiful, all-screen smartphones with Full HD+ resolution displays and a 20:9 ratio. We honestly think that the 32GB with 3GB RAM that this phone has to offer may be a bit limiting. Especially 32GB, the RAM one can work with if you are not a heavy user. And the storage infrastructure is eMMC 5.1. Thankfully this internal storage can be expanded via a microSDXC card. There is a dedicated slot for this feature.

Still, under the hood is an Octa-core (4×2.3 GHz Cortex-A53 & 4×1.8 GHz Cortex-A53) CPU. The phone itself is powered by Android 11 (Go edition), Funtouch 11.1. This can be described as a pretty lightweight OS that is neat and almost bloatware-free. Almost! Actually, it is very quiet to the stock Android experience. But of course, it has a lot of customization options. Otherwise, it would just be pure Android 11. You can customize your charging animation, or even the face unlock animation. And note that it is Android 11 (Go edition).

Cameras

Vivo Y15s is an affordable smartphone with a dual-camera setup. It comes with a 113 MP, f/2.2, 27mm (wide), AF camera lens. This lens has an Auto-focus feature. Below it is its 2 MP, f/2.4, depth sensor. This is not all. The phone also has an okay 8 MP, f/2.0 selfie shooter capable of shooting [email protected] videos just like the main 13MP lens. Now that is impressive. And in case you are wondering, a depth-sensing lens will come in handy when you want to blur the background of a portrait image. Some camera features present here include LED flash and panorama. The camera module looks neat on the back panel, to be honest. 

Battery

Vivo Y15s comes with a large capacity non-removable Li-Po 5,000 mAh battery. This one features normal charging 10W. This massive battery capacity should last up to a whole day of usage and sometimes even two until the next charge is required. Buy it (phone not battery) today at Phoneplace Kenya. What we also know and find onboard here is reverse charging. Though it is only supported in 5W speed.

description:
Oppo A96

The Oppo A96 price in Kenya is Ksh 35,500. The Oppo A96 has a 6.43 inch AMOLED display, Android 11, ColorOS 11.1, Qualcomm SM6375 Snapdragon 695 5G (6 nm) chipset. Oppo A96 also comes with 128 GB of internal storage and 8 GB RAM, a triple 48 MP main camera, and a 5000 mAh battery. It is available in the color Black, Blue, and Pink.

Oppo A96 Specs and price in Kenya

Price   Ksh. 35,500
Camera 48 MP + 2 MP
Selfie 16 MP
Display 6.43 inches, AMOLED
Storage 128GB, 8GB RAM
Chipset Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 5G
O.S Android 11, ColorOS 11.1
Battery Li-Po 4500 mAh, 33W

Display

This basically is the same display as the one present on the Oppo A95. One would say that one is AMOLED and the other OLED. To which we respond, what difference is there? Well, what we have got here? A very nice 6.43 inch OLED display with 2,400 by 1080P resolution and what equals 409 PPI. It’s got the standard 60 Hertz refresh rate and 120 Hertz touch sampling rate. Well, the display is bright enough to use indoors and outdoors. It has crisp screen colors that are vibrant and offers good viewing angles.

The screen can also go up to a total brightness of 600 nits. As usual, the display of Oppo A96 5G is customizable from your usual night mode and screen color mode to dark mode settings that can let you set how dark you want to go. You can also get an Always-On display and low brightness flicker-free iComfort option. As for the ratio of the display to that of the body of the phone, it is an 85.3% screen-to-body ratio. Also, note that the Fingerprint is under this display and it is an optical one.

Cameras

This model consists of a dual-camera setup featuring a main 48 MP, f/1.7, 26mm (wide), PDAF, and a 2 MP, f/2.4, (depth). Meanwhile, for selfies, you get a 16 MP, f/2.4, 27mm (wide), 1/3.06″, and 1.0µm, shooter. In natural daylight, the photos come out decent with present details. It is definitely worthy of your social media uploads. You can zoom up to 2X, 5X, and 10X. For selfies, it performs pretty well, especially in bright conditions.

Oppo A96 5G can capture some sharp selfies with a natural-looking skin tone. The selfie also supports portrait shops. There’s also a front night mode that lets you take clear and brighter selfies even in dark areas. For videos, users can shoot up to [email protected], [email protected]/60/120fps, gyro-EIS, and the impressive. This is with the main camera since videos of the selfie are capped at [email protected] Video stabilization is also present so you don’t have to worry about shaky videos.

Platform

Fixing our attention now to the software department of Oppo A96 5G is ColorOS 11.1 which is based on Android 11. There are tons of customization options here where you can change icon styles, app layout, fingerprint style, change font, and colors. There’s also an app drawer option in the settings and you can easily adjust the navigation buttons the way you want them to be arranged. Storage-wise out of the A96 5G’s 256 GB that you get. what you are left with is 229 GB out of the box.

The Oppo A96 5G has a Qualcomm SM6375 Snapdragon 695 5G (6 nm) chipset which is brand new. It has been totally revamped in comparison to its predecessor and has both more powerful cores and 5G connectivity. This one is great for day-to-day tasks and it is also pretty good with games. Present here also is an Octa-core (2×2.2 GHz Kryo 660 Gold & 6×1.7 GHz Kryo 660 Silver) CPU and an Adreno 619 GPU. Its, GPU, performance is 60% better compared to the Adreno 612 graphics card and in our benchmarks on par with the 700 series cards.

Battery and more

So then how’s the battery life. Well, the Oppo A96 5G has an endurance rating of 93 hours. It does pack a heft Li-Po 4,500 mAh, a non-removable battery which is an improvement. Of course, fast battery charging is available on this one. The same is Fast charging 33W, 100% in 63 min (advertised), and present also is Reverse charging and USB Power Delivery. For audio, loudspeaker quality is okay. There’s a 3.5-millimeter audio jack on the phone for headphones but only a mono-speaker.

  1. How much does Oppo A96 cost? – The base approximate price of the Oppo A96 is around KES 26,500 shillings in Kenya.\
  2. What is the release date for Oppo A96? – The official release date is 2022, March 16.
  3. What is the screen size of Oppo A96, and how big is it? – The screen size of the Oppo A96 is 6.59″ inches.
  4. Does Oppo A96 support 5G? – No, it does not support 5G.
  5. Is Oppo A96 waterproof? – Yes, it is waterproof.
  6. Does Oppo A96 have fast charging? -Yes, it supports fast charging.
  7. Does Oppo A96 have wireless charging? – No, it does not support wireless charging.
  8. Does Oppo A96 have to Google Play Services? – Yes, it supports the services of Google Play Store, Gmail, youtube, etc.
  9. How many cameras does the Oppo A96 have? – There is a dual main camera and a single selfie camera.

The Realme C35 runs on the Android 11 platform, powered by a 5,000 mAh battery. The Unisoc Tiger T612 (12 nm) processor enables the phone to operate optimally and seamlessly as you run through the applications and daily usage. Realme C35 parks a triple main camera (50MP+2MP+0.3MP) at the rear and an 8MP selfie lens at the front. Buy the Realme C35 today at PhonePlace Kenya.

Overall Design, Build and Display

Realme C35 weighs 189g and measures 164.4×75.6×8.1mm. It makes the device quite comfortable to hold, carry around and even use as you multi-task. An ergonomic design of the device, with rounded edges, a water-drop, a centered notched front display, and a simplistic look, make it attractive. The 6.6-inch IPS LCD display proudly and beautifully sits on the front of the device. At 1080 x 2408 pixels, it has one of the brightest displays for smartphones in its price range and specifications.

The aesthetic finishing of the budget smartphone makes it worth its face value. The designers put a lot of thought into developing the device, with a side-mounted fingerprint sensor, a triple black colored camera ring in a stylish rectangular mount, and an exquisite choice of colors. Realme C35 is available in Kenya and Phoneplace Kenya in two unique color options: Glowing Black, and Glowing Green. The back and frame of the Realme C35 are plastic, and the front predominantly displays glass.

Camera.

The front upper center of the device has an 8 MP, f/2.0 aperture, 26mm (wide) camera. Not the best of specifications, but it will give you a good performance both for video and selfie snapshots. The device packs a triple 50 MP (wide camera)+2MP (macro camera)+0.3MP (depth camera) integrated camera system at the rear. Whereas the front camera captures 720p [email protected], the rear primary camera captures 1080p videos at 30fps.

Performance and Storage

As a mid-range phone, most features on the Realme C35 are fairly up to the task in a rapidly advancing and demanding environment. It runs on Android 11, Realme Go UI. A 2, 4/6GB RAM, and 64/128GB internal memory provide the necessary space for the default applications and those downloaded by the user for convenience and preferences. A 64/128GB internal memory is quite sufficient for daily optimal running of the device, without running out of space.

Thoughtfully, the phone comes with a MicroSDXC (dedicated slot), enabling an additional 1TB of storage. Although the OS is Android 11, it works perfectly. It performs superbly considering it has a powerful Unisoc Tiger T616 (12 nm) chipset, Octa-core (2×2.0 GHz Cortex-A75 & 6×1.8 GHz Cortex-A55) processor, and Mali-G57 MP1 Graphics Unit Processor (GPU). These specifications are sufficient to play mobile video games on the device, especially for random, users who do not put a lot of demand on their devices with high-grade games.

Battery, Charging, and Connectivity.

A massive 5,000mAh powers the Realme C35. The Li-Po battery is charged by a wired 18W Fast Charger, making it convenient even for heavy phone users, who need reliable power, and fast charging on the go. The battery guarantees two days of normal usage, which is incredible considering most of the target segment of the budget smartphones are average users. The fast-wired charger connects to the phone through a Type-C 2.0 USB port.

In terms of connectivity, the realme phone supports up to 4G connectivity, with speeds up to HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE-A. It has a micro USB port for charging and transfer of data. The device supports Bluetooth connectivity (5.0, A2DP, LE), Wi-Fi 802.11, and Hotspot Connectivity when sharing the internet with other devices and an FM Radio.

description:
Huawei MatePad T10s price in Kenya

Huawei MatePad T 10s price in Kenya is Ksh 27,000. The MatePad T 10s phone features 10.1 inches IPS display with a resolution of 1200 x 1920 pixels. The phone has a single-camera setup that consists of a 5MP and a 2MP camera for selfies. It runs on the Kirin 710A processor with Mali-G51 MP4 GPU. It has 4GB RAM, 64GB storage and runs on EMUI based on Android 10. The phone is available in Deepsea Blue colors and is powered by a 5100mAh, non-removable. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Huawei MatePad T 10s specs and price in Kenya

CPU Kirin 710A
RAM 4GB
Storage 64GB
Display 10.1-inch FHD+
Rear Camera 5MP  Sensor
Battery 5,100mAh
Front Camera 2MP Sensor
OS EMUI 10.1
Android 10
Huawei Mobile Services (HMS)
Colour Deepsea Blue
Price in Kenya Ksh 27,000

Design and build

Starting with the design the Huawei MatePad T 10s looks a lot like the Matepad T8. It comes in the same colors too are Gold and Deepsea Blue. The tablet looks sleek and professional, and it feels hold for a tablet. This one has got a metal body with a matte finish on it. And if you look a little closer, you’ll notice that the vertically aligned thin bar near the rear camera is made out of polycarbonate material.

Other than that, you can find some Huawei and Harmon Kardon branding here. Located on the right are its power and volume buttons, as well as microphones. There’s nothing on the left. But on top, you’ll find a loudspeaker. Moving over to the bottom part there is another loudspeaker together with its USB type C port, headphone port, and a dual SIM tray for one Nano SIM card and a microSD card that’s expandable up to 512GB. In landscape mode, you can spot the 2-megapixel front camera together with the LED notification and some sensors at the top bezel. Overall, the MatePad T 10s has a straightforward design.

Full HD Display

Focusing on the Huawei MatePad T 10s display now. Upfront is a decent 10.1 inches IPS screen with a resolution of 1920 by 1200 pixels and a pixel density of 224 pixels per inch. The quality is good enough for watching videos, browsing the web, scrolling through social media, as well as reading eBooks. You can take advantage of the ebook mode that filters the blue light to reduce eye strain. The brightness levels indoors are good, but you really have to toggle to max brightness if you’re going to use it under direct sunlight.

Performance

When it comes to storage, we have 64GB with 46 gigabytes of usable space. If you need extra space to store your video of photos and music, there’s a dedicated microSD card slot for up to 512 gigabytes. Preinstalled apps are kept to a minimum and you can always uninstall them if you’re not planning on using them. As for internals, the Huawei MatePad T 10s has a Kirin 710A (14 nm) chipset paired with a Mali-G51 MP4 GPU and 3GB RAM. Performance is deliverable! You get a smooth experience as long as you don’t keep too many apps running in the background.

HMS platform

Moving on to software, the Huawei MatePad T 10s runs on Android 10 skinned with Huawei’s EMUI 10.1. And as expected it doesn’t have Google mobile services. Instead, it relies on HMS, Huawei Mobile Services with their own app marketplace called App Gallery which has grown its catalog at a rapid pace. It already has most of the popular apps. If the app is not available, you can go to a reliable third-party app store like APK Pure or APK mirror and download from there. But if you use a lot of Google apps, it can be extra challenging to sideload specific apps, such as YouTube and Gmail.

Otherwise, you can always use the browser for it and create shortcuts to your home screen. Back to it, since you have a big screen, you can also take advantage of the multi-window feature for better multitasking. There’s also the Huawei app multiplier to allow the spontaneous operation of the same app. Other notable features are tablet clown, kids’ corner, and there’s also an FM Radio available.

Cameras

What you are getting here is a 5 megapixel at the back and a 2 MP upfront. Of course, don’t expect too much from these lenses as tablets today are really built for photography. Nevertheless, the quality of the Huawei MatePad T 10s isn’t that bad. The rear camera produces decent sharpness with not-so-vibrant colors. The same can be said with the front camera. But it’s good enough for video calls. It also comes with a beauty mode in case you really want to take selfies for social media. And as for video quality, the front camera has a 720 P resolution. While the rear shooter allows you to shoot up to 1080P. Generally, its cameras should suffice for your zoom calls or quick snapshots.

Quality sound

Huawei MatePad T 10s will make you happy if you are into watching movies and playing games. This is because of its stereo speakers which have been Tuned by Harman Kardon. That is right. Tuned by Harman Kardon! The sound produced on this one is above average. Considering its price one wouldn’t really ask for more. It’s loud, clear noticeably, rich and fuller compared to smartphones.

More features

Quickly on security on Huawei MatePad T 10s, you can unlock the device with a pin pattern or password. Yep. There’s no face unlock or fingerprint scanner here. As for connectivity, the MatePad T 10s has the basic phone feature such as LTE connectivity, WiFi, Bluetooth 5.0, and OTG battery-wise t packs a Li-Po 5100 mAh, non-removable battery with 10 Watts charging. If you’ll be using this tablet casually, with limited use, then it can last you a whole day.

Our take

As more people work and study at home, tablets are slowly getting more attention than they used to just a year ago, 2019. They’re obviously bigger than a phone yet more affordable than laptops. So it’s definitely something to consider, especially when you’re on a tight budget. And Huawei MatePad T 10s is a budget-friendly tablet. Visit this product’s official website to learn more.

Check out more Tablets on our website

description:
Xiaomi Mi 11T

The Xiaomi 11T price in Kenya is KSh 53,000. Xiaomi 11T has a 6.67-inch FHD+ 120Hz AdaptiveSync AMOLED flat display, up to 480Hz touch sampling rate, TrueColor, and HDR10+. The Xiaomi 11T runs on the MediaTek Dimensity 1200-ultra processor with 8GB RAM and 256GB UFS 3.1 storage. The phone comes in colors come in Meteorite Gray, Moonlight White, and Celestial Blue with a brushed finish. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Xiaomi 11T Specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya  Ksh. 53,000
Display 6.67 inches, AMOLED, 120 Hz
Processor MediaTek MT6893 Dimensity 1200 5G
Sim Card Hybrid Dual SIM
Connectivity GSM / HSPA / LTE / 5G
OS Android 11, MIUI 12.5
RAM 8 GB
Storage 256GB
Card Slot No
Camera 108MP + 8MP + 5MP
Selfie 16MP
3.5mm jack Yes
USB Port USB Type-C 2.0
Fingerprint Fingerprint (side-mounted)
Battery Li-Po 5000
Charging Fast charging 67W
Colors Meteorite Gray, Moonlight White, Celestial Blue

Design and build

The Xiaomi 11T brings exactly the same looks like the Pro model. They’re pretty hard to tell apart. But on the inside, there are a handful of differences feature-wise. The design is pretty sleek featuring a two-step camera bump and a really reflective curved glass back panel. A closer look will expose its subtle texture that looks like metal. The aluminum frame is also curved and is covered by a matte finish. And something you get here that many other mid-rangers don’t provide is protection against water and dust. This is to confirm that the 11T has an IP53, dust, and splash protection rating.

Cameras

As for the cameras, Xiaomi 11T and 11T Pro have the same set of cameras. But the different chipsets have resulted in different processing and performance. There are three cameras on the back, a 108 MP, f/1.8, 26mm (wide), 1/1.52″, 0.7µm, PDAF main camera, an 8 MP, f/2.2, 120˚ (ultrawide), 1/4″, 1.12µm, and a 5 MP, f/2.4, 50mm (telephoto macro), 1/5.0″, 1.12µm, AF camera. 12 megapixel shots from the main camera are great. They are rich in organic detail. Portraits taken with the main cam are good with decent subject separation. But the lack of HDR means more challenging scenes may become blown out.

The ultra-wide camera’s performance is actually great for this sort of camera. Its 8 megapixel photos are sharp and detailed, noise is kept under control and dynamic range is very good. 5 megapixel close-ups from the macro camera are pretty nice.

Selfies from the 16-megapixel front-facing camera are just okay, yes okay at best. Onto video recording, which can be done with the main cam and up to 4k resolution at 30 fps. This footage is excellent. There is a lot of detail with natural rendition with dynamic ranges at the flagship level. The ultrawide camera shoots in 1080p. The detail is all right for this resolution. And the dynamic range is good. There is electronic stabilization available even in 4k on the main camera. It does an excellent job at ironing out handheld shake.

Display

Let’s check out its display then Xiaomi 11T has a 6.67 inch AMOLED with a fast 120 Hz refresh rate and Gorilla Glass Victus protection. Yes, you read that right, Gorilla Glass Victus. Anyway, thanks to the high refresh rate swiping and scrolling are quite smooth. And the screen is extra responsive because of its high 480 Hertz touch sampling rate. The screen’s refresh rate will adapt to certain apps like YouTube. This display is quite premium, especially for a mid-ranger. You do get support for 10-bit colors (1B colors). Speaking of which, colors are accurate and there are plenty of options to tweak them in settings. HDR 10 Plus support is also available here. Would have been nice if you did get Dolby vision here like on the Pro model.

Platform & performance

As for storage options, you get 128 or 256 gigabytes which are not expandable so be in the know. The interface of the Xiaomi 11T is the latest MIUI 12.5 based on Android 11. At its core is the same interface we from Xiaomi for the past while with a familiar layout and features. And Xiaomi promises three major Android updates and four major security patches. Its MediaTek MT6893 Dimensity 1200 5G (6 nm) chipset also sets it apart from the Pro version. It provides upper mid-range level performance, as well as 5G connectivity. It stands strong against phones running Qualcomm Snapdragon 700 series chips. There’s more than enough power here for smooth and dependable daily performance, as well as gaming.

Battery with fast charge

Now both the Pro version and Xiaomi 11T have a Li-Po 5000 mAh, non-removable battery capacity. But battery life is slightly better on this model with an endurance score of 98 hours in GSM Arena proprietary tests. The charging speed though is a different story altogether as the 11T supports 67-watt fast charging, and the adapter comes in the box. It’s super fast able to charge the phone from 0 to 86% in half an hour. Which, wait for it, is still much slower than the 120 watts charging you get with the Pro model.

More features

Another difference is that you don’t get Harman Kardon branded audio. But the actual stereo speaker setup looks the same here. One thing missing on this phone though is a traditional headphone jack. For biometrics, the Xiaomi 11T has a side-mounted fingerprint reader that doubles as the power button. As expected it is fast and reliable

Our take

With this phone, 11T comes some pretty high-level specs for a mid-ranger. You can pay more for the 11T Pro version which brings a higher tier chipset and even faster charging. But this one, according to our judgment is just the best deal. Xiaomi 11T is a flagship killer through and through with a powerful chipset, a 120 Hertz AMOLED, stereo speakers, competitive cameras, and fast charging. You even get water resistance. This phone is a great value-packed smartphone and is definitely worth recommending.

description:
Motorola G20 in Kenya

The Motorola Moto G20 price in Kenya is Ksh 26,000. Running on the Unisoc T700 processor with Mali G52 GPU, the Moto G20 has 4 GB RAM and 128 GB of internal storage which is expandable using microSDXC. The Motorola Moto G20 has a 6.5 inches, 720 x 1600 pixels IPS display with a pixel density of 270 PPI. Coming to cameras, it has a 48 MP rear camera and a 13 MP front camera for selfies. The Moto G20 runs on Android 11 and all this is powered by a 5000 mAh battery.

Motorola G20 price in Kenya and specs

Price in Kenya Ksh 26,000
Display 6.5-inch, 90Hz
Processor  Unisoc T700
RAM 4GB
Storage 64GB / 128GB
Operating system Android 11
Rear Cameras 48MP + 8MP + 2MP + 2MP
Front Camera 13MP
Dimensions 165.2 x 75.7 x 9.1 mm
Weight 200 g
Connectivity Dual 4G VoLTE, Wi-Fi 802.11 ac (2.4GHz + 5GHz), Bluetooth 5.0, GPS + GLONASS, USB Type-C
Battery 5000mAh Charging 10W

Design

The Motorola Moto G20 design is fairly traditional. That is t say conventional to Motorola. It has a curved plastic uni-body that tapers into the edges. G20 is available in the colors Breeze Blue, and Flamingo Pink. The material feels plasticky to the touch. As by now we have come to expect from a Motorola mid-ranger, the motor G20 has a water repellent coating on its internals. This gives you some extra peace of mind.

Display – 90 Hz

Arguably the Motorola Moto G20 stands out feature s its high refresh rate display! Well, just moderately high at 90 Hertz. But besides that, this screen is an average panel. It’s a 6.5 inch LCD with a 720P (720 x 1600 pixels) resolution and a notch for the selfie camera. With a pixel density of just 269 PPI, this isn’t the sharpest screen around. And if you look closely, you can see some graininess here and there. However, its contrast is remarkable.

The blacks here are some of the deepest on an LCD. As far as the high refresh rate goes, there are three modes to choose from 60 Hertz and 90 Hertz which lock in the rate, and auto mode, which is adaptive. It will dial back to 60 when you’re not interacting with the screen. There are some display-related features on Motorola Moto G20 too. The attentive display disables screen timeout. While you’re looking at the phone. And the peak display is a nice alternative to an always-on display, showing you the time and notifications every time you pick up the phone.

Audio and other features

For audio Motorola, Moto G20 has a single speaker on the bottom. And it isn’t too loud scoring an average rating on charts. The sound of the highs here can be preferred over the cheaper Motorola Moto G20 though. You also have a 3.5-millimeter jack for traditional headphones. And you can listen to FM radio if you have headphones plugged in. Waking up and unlocking the Motorola Moto G20 is done with the rear-mounted fingerprint scanner. It is stamped with the Moto logo. It’s reliable, but the wake-up animation is on the slower side.

You may also be interested in Motorola G30

Design

The Motorola Moto G30 design is fairly traditional. That is t say conventional to Motorola. It has a curved plastic uni-body that tapers into the edges. G30 is available in the colors Phantom Black (Dark Pearl), and Pastel Sky. The material feels plasticky to the touch. As by now we have come to expect from a Motorola mid-ranger, the motor G30 has a water repellent coating on its internals. This gives you some extra peace of mind.

Performance

There is support for NFC on the Motorola Moto G30 for connectivity and payment without contact. And storage is expandable here on top of the 64 or 128 GB built-in through a hybrid, not dedicated slot. One feature you won’t find just anywhere is a dedicated button for Google assistant. It’s convenient to see it here but it’s pretty high up on the phone and hard to reach. The Moto G30 interface is almost stock Android 11 with some neat Motorola features sprinkled in. The Android experience here is smooth and straightforward and you get Google’s newest additions. These include one-time permissions, notification, grouping, and messaging bubbles.

Behind all of these features of the Motorola Moto G30 is a Qualcomm SM6115 Snapdragon 662 chipset built on an 11-nanometer process. It’s a relatively recent mid-range chipset that prioritizes power efficiency. The Moto G30 has a large 5,000 mAh battery and battery life is impressive. It scores an endurance rating of 131 hours in proprietary tests. Charging speed is acceptable for the class, but nothing special. With the bundled 20-watt quick charge adapter you get to charge from 0 to 32% and half an hour.

Cameras

We hurry on to the Motorola Moto G30 cameras. There’s a 64-megapixel quad main cam, an 8-megapixel Ultrawide cam a 2-megapixel macro camera, and a 2MP depth sensor. Photos from the main cam come out at 16 megapixels by default. And they’re overall very good. There’s a lot of fine detail with natural-looking textures, nice contrast, and excellent dynamic range. Portraits are taken with the help of the depth sensor. And these are great with competent subject detection.

Display – 90 Hz

Arguably the Motorola Moto G30 stands out feature s its high refresh rate display! Well, just moderately high at 90 Hertz. But besides that, this screen is an average panel. It’s a 6.5 inch LCD with a 720 P resolution and a notch for the selfie camera. With a pixel density of just 270 PPI, this isn’t the sharpest screen around. And if you look closely, you can see some graininess here and there. However, its contrast is remarkable.

The blacks here are some of the deepest on an LCD. As far as the high refresh rate goes, there are three modes to choose from 60 Hertz and 90 Hertz which lock in the rate, and auto mode, which is adaptive. It will dial back to 60 when you’re not interacting with the screen. There are some display-related features too. The attentive display disables screen timeout. While you’re looking at the phone. And the peak display is a nice alternative to an always-on display, showing you the time and notifications every time you pick up the phone

Audio and other features

For audio Motorola, Moto G30 has a single speaker on the bottom. And it isn’t too loud scoring an average rating on charts. The sound of the highs here can be preferred over the cheaper Motorola Moto G30 though. You also have a 3.5-millimeter jack for traditional headphones. And you can listen to FM radio if you have headphones plugged in. Waking up and unlocking the Motorola Moto G30 is done with the rear-mounted fingerprint scanner. It is stamped with the Moto logo. It’s reliable, but the wake-up animation is on the slower side.

description:
Apple Airpods Pro in Kenya

The Apple Airpods Pro price in Kenya is Ksh 26000. Airpods Pro has been designed to deliver Active Noise Cancellation for immersive sound, Transparency mode so you can hear your surroundings, and a customizable fit for all-day comfort. Just like AirPods, AirPods Pro connects magically to your iPhone or Apple Watch. And they’re ready to use right out of the case. Buy the latest AirPods Pro 2.

Airpods Pro Features

  • IPX4 is rated to resist sweat and water, making them ideal for sports and exercise
  • Internally tapered tips conform to your ear shape while vents help equalize pressure for maximum comfort
  • Active Noise Cancellation continuously adapts to the geometry of your ear and the fit of the ear tips to keep you isolated from the world around you
  • Press and hold the force sensor on the stem to switch between Active Noise Cancellation and Transparency Mode, which allows outside sound in to keep you aware of your environment
  • Expanded mesh microphone port increases call clarity in windy locations
  • H1 headphone chip features 10 audio cores for low processing latency and real-time noise cancellation
  • Bluetooth 5.0 for reliable, high-quality reception
  • Automatically on, automatically connected
  • One-tap setup for your Apple devices
  • Voice-enabled access to Siri
  • Audio Sharing enables you and a friend to enjoy the same song or movie by simply bringing a second pair of AirPods close to your iPhone or iPad
  • More than 24-hour battery life with charging case
  • With the included Wireless MagSafe Charging Case, charging is as simple as placing the AirPods case on a Qi/MagSafe-compatible charging mat (available separately)

Active Noise Cancellation

Incredibly light noise-canceling headphones, Apple Airpods Pro block out your environment so you can focus on what you’re listening to. AirPods Pro uses two microphones, an outward-facing microphone, and an inward-facing microphone, to create superior noise cancellation. Active Noise Cancellation silences the world to keep you fully tuned in to your music, podcasts, and calls by continuously adapting to the geometry of your ear and the fit of the ear tips.

Transparency mode

Switch to Transparency mode and AirPods Pro lets the outside sound in, allowing you to hear and connect to your surroundings. Outward- and inward-facing microphones enable Apple Airpods Pro to undo the sound-isolating effect of the silicone tips. Hence, things sound and feel natural, like when you’re talking to people around you.

All-new design

Apple Airpods Pro offers a more customizable fit with three sizes of flexible silicone tips to choose from. With an internal taper, they conform to the shape of your ear, securing your AirPods Pro in place and creating an exceptional seal for superior noise cancellation.

Amazing audio quality

A custom-built high-excursion, low-distortion driver delivers powerful bass. A super efficient high dynamic range amplifier produces pure, incredibly clear sound while extending battery life. And Adaptive EQ automatically tunes the music to suit the shape of your ear for a rich, consistent listening experience.

Even more magical

The Apple-designed H1 chip delivers incredibly low audio latency. A force sensor on the stem makes it easy to control music and calls and switch between ANC and Transparency Mode. Announce Messages with Siri gives you the option to have Siri read your messages through your Apple Airpods Pro. With Audio Sharing, you and a friend can share the same audio stream on two sets of AirPods. You can play a game, watch a movie, or listen to a song together.

description:
Nokia T20 price in Kenya

The Nokia T20 price in Kenya is Ksh 23,400. Nokia T20 brings the classic Nokia quality to the big screen and helps you find a better work-life balance. Its crystal clear 2K screen lets you see both work presentations and movie marathons in stunning detail, and enhanced speakers and dual microphones help you hear and be heard better. Take part in the worldwide phenomenon of Continual Conversations and enjoy a clear and crisp voice conversation with your team or customer. Packed with features, the Nokia T20 is the perfect phone for work and play.

Nokia T20 specs and price in Kenya

Price Ksh. 23,400
Display 10.4 inch
OS Android 11
Sim Card Dual SIM
Colors Deep Ocean
Radio Wireless FM radio
RAM 4GB
Storage 64GB
Battery Li-Ion 8200 mAh

Unboxing and Design

The first and most obvious question is what do you get in the box of the Nokia T20? And the answer is a charger, a USB cable type C, and about 10 trees worth of starter guides. And that’s it for the box. Nice and straightforward. First impressions of the T20 tablet. It is obviously a budget device but it does feel a little bit more premium than Amazon’s Fire HD 10 for instance.

The plastic back looks rather nice. It could almost pass as metal, got a matte finish which hopefully should repel the worst of finger greasings. Definitely feels solidly put together. You’ve got toughened glass upfront as well. Just to help give it an extra bit of protection. This tablet is surprisingly lightweight as well. It has got nicely rounded corners with a strange positioning of the headphone Jack which is actually stuck away at its bottom right corner.

Display

Now, the Nokia T20 rocks very respectable 10.4-inch displays of 2000 x 1200 pixel resolutions. Its visuals are reasonably crisp despite the fact that it’s obviously quite a spacious screen. Certainly, you’ve got enough. It is just a simple IPS panel. So don’t expect super sharp contrast and unrealistically vivid colors. And it maxes out at 400 nits (typ) which is fine for indoor use. The view angles are good enough. Sadly there is no way to change the refresh rate though. It is stuck at 60 Hertz. And the Nokia T20 has a stereo speaker arrangement. Both of those speakers are housed on the edge of the tablet. And it’s a reasonably good audio setup. There’s a clear distinction between the left and the right channels. Decent clarity as well.

Platform

HMD global has not tinkered with Android here. It’s a stock version of Android 11 on the Nokia T20. The main difference is that the Google feed is heavily focused on video, games, and stuff to read. As well on the video side of things, you can get recommendations to watch from the likes of YouTube, Disney Plus, etc. But it does not have Netflix support even though it is fully customizable. It’s quite a limited selection, but a pretty good way of just seeing some of the latest releases on various platforms.

Extra features

Another feature that HMD has added to the Nokia T20 on top of Android is Face Unlock. You’ve also got Kid Space loaded on here. And as always one of the benefits for Nokia devices is the fact you’ve got guaranteed updates stretching into the future two years of all OS updates. What this means is that you will be getting Android 12 later on. And then Android 13 after that and three years of security updates as well. This Nokia T20 has 64 GB of storage to play with here. There is a 32 GB variant in some regions as well. But the good news is you can expand that via an SD card if you like.

Performance

Now performance as you’d expect, it’s fairly basic here on the Nokia T20 as it is just a budget tablet. Power comes courtesy of the Unisoc T610 (12 nm) chipset that offers basic platform performance. But the T20 certainly seems up to the job for simple stuff like streaming videos, browsing the internet, and so on. The great thing is that the tablet shows no signs of heating up as you would expect from a basic chipset.

What we must be thankful for is its 64GB internal storage, and especially that beefy 4GB RAM it comes with. The 32GB vraiant has 3GB RAM. And stuffed inside of the T20 is a Li-Po 8200 mAh, non-removable battery. It should keep you going all day long depending on what you are using to tablet for. It supports Fast charging 15W.

Cameras

Yes Nokia T20 has a selfie built into the top end of the display there when you’re holding it in a landscape. This one should do fine for your video chats as its large display keeps your face reasonably bright. You’ve also got the rear camera here. It is an 8 MP, AF shooter and that is just about what I can say about it.

Our take

So definitely if you’re looking for a budget-friendly tablet for the entire family, this is a strong alternative to those Amazon fire tabs. Especially if you want a nice clean stock Android vibe than that really heavy Amazon UI. Also, Nokia T20 is the first T-series Nokia tablet. Its manufacturer HMD global is being all nice to the planet and planting 10 trees for every T20 tablet that you buy.

description:
Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 Lite

Samsung Galaxy Tab s6 Lite price in Kenya is 46,000 Kenya shillings. It is exactly what it sounds like. A stripped-down version of Samsung’s flagship Android tablet. Is it good enough to stand on its own or did they take out too much? Let’s check it out.

Galaxy Tab S6 Lite specs and price in Kenya

Price Ksh. 46,000
Display 10.4″ inch TFT LCD
Processor 2.3GHz Octa-core Exynos 9611
Sim Card Single SIM (Nano-SIM)
Connectivity 2G, 3G, 4G
OS Android 10, One UI2
RAM 4 GB
ROM 64 GB
Memory Card Slot Yes
Rear Camera 8 MP (wide)
Front Camera 5 MP
3.5mm Jack Yes
USB Port 3.1, Type-C 1.0 reversible connector
Fingerprint Sensor No
Battery Non-removable Li-Po 7040 mAh
Battery charging 15W (Quick Charge)
Color Chiffon Pink, Angora Blue, Oxford Gray

Introduction

Samsung Galaxy Tab s6 Lite comes with Samsung’s Qualcomm-powered S-pen. An incredibly capable pen packaged right here in with every single s6 Lite. And all this for only 44,000 Kenya shillings. To break it down, this is a great deal. You can get drawing displays for less. But they aren’t super portable. They need to be connected to a computer or you can get something like an iPad for around this price point, which is comparable.

The Galaxy Tab s6 Lite is a fully functional Android tablet. It has everything you need right here and one lightweight portable shell. It also comes with four months of YouTube without ads. So if you want to binge-watch your favorite YouTuber, you can do that.

The S-Pen

The pen magnetically sticks to the side of the tablet similar to the surface pro pen or the Apple pencil. I much prefer this to the way the tab S6 pen is positioned along the back. I think this is because it doesn’t have to charge. There’s no battery in the pen, so you can throw those magnets anywhere on the tablet.

Either way, I find this position way more comfortable for storage. Overall. This is a very capable Android tablet. But what compromises are you making jumping down from the S6? First, we have no fingerprint reader under the glass, which isn’t so much of a surprise there, but you still get facial recognition by using the front-facing camera.

Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 Lite Display

The display here is a TFT LCD screen and I’m going, to be honest. I think that the difference between the LCD screens and the AMOLED screens is overrated. Yes, there is a difference. Yes! AMOLED is better. It gets brighter, it gets dimmer. There’s a wider range, more color, but the only way I’ve been able to tell the difference is by putting the two screens right next to each other.

If you tend to use your devices in really sunny places or take them outside or use them in the dark a lot. That sort of thing might matter to you. But I don’t think it’s that big a deal, especially when you’re looking at the price difference between them. There are also no connector pins on the back of the tablet for say a keyboard peripheral.

Let’s talk about the specs. We’re going to start with the display itself. It’s 10.4 inches corner to corner with a 2000 x 1200 pixel resolution. It’s got an octa-core processor, 4 gigs of Ram, and comes with either 64 gigabytes or 128 gigabytes of storage. It gets the job done for most tasks. Bouncing between apps, multitasking in any drawing app that I use.

All of that is going to run just fine. One place where you’re going to see a difference though is gaming. It’s not going to be as fast as the standard Galaxy S6 tab. On the back. You’re going to find an 8-megapixel camera and then flip it around to the front and you’ve got your 5-megapixel camera. The S-pen itself is battery-free. So you are giving up some of the Bluetooth features that you find in the tab Galaxy S6.

Dex and software

And what about decks? Nope, it’s not here. I was a little bit surprised because I always think of Dex as a software thing here. Dex turns your Samsung device into a computer when you connect it to an external monitor. I don’t use it much, but I liked the concept. Let’s turn your phone into your everything device. Probably the reason they haven’t included it here is that the USB connector at the bottom is a 1.0 USB connector, even though it’s a USB-C-shaped connector.

Of course, the last thing you’re losing, which I mentioned before, aired the Bluetooth features on the pen, the ability to scroll through pictures using the pen or take a picture from a distance. Some of the things that add though are pretty good. For example, there’s a headphone Jack here. Not that you need it because I found the two speakers, one on either side are pretty good. The battery is solid, it should last you most of the day and it supports fast charging. I also want to shout out to the case at Samsung made for this thing.

Drawing experience

Let’s talk about drawing. Samsung has licensed Qualcomm tech, which is a really good thing. As far as the actual drawing experience, the pen is fantastic. Okay. It might be overstating it a bit. It’s a good drawing experience. Lines are pretty smooth, pressure works well, it’s predictable. It’s everything that I want out of a pen. There is one downside. It is that we have palm rejection and it’s not great palm rejection. Most of the time it works well, but, commonly, you lift your Palm after drawing and you leave little marks on the canvas.

Conclusion

Pros and cons. If you’re going to be using this for drawing and only drawing, then I don’t see a big between this and his big brother, the S6 Tab. Yeah, you’re going to lose some of the bells and whistles. You can tell that it’s a little bit of a step down here and there. But I think the core elements, the most important things that you need are, are all there. It’s a good drawing tablet. The cons? Well, you can go down the spec sheet and point out how it’s not as good as the more expensive S6.

But all in all, nothing is glaring here. There were no. showstoppers. Often with a windows tablet, when you get to the lowest configuration. But here, the lowest-end configuration still runs Android well. You’re going to see the lack of processing when you get to gaming apps and things like that. But for everyday things, the things you would use it for, it’s fine.

description:
Oppo A55

The Oppo A55 price in Kenya is Ksh 24,300. It comes with 4 gigabytes of RAM, 128 gigabytes of internal storage, a 16-megapixel selfie camera. The main camera consists of 50MP + 2MP + 2MP lens. The A55 has a 6.51 inches IPS display with 550 nits brightness. The phone is powered by a 5000 mAh battery with 18 Watts Fast charging.  Powering this device is the MediaTek MT6765G Helio G35 chipset.

Oppo A55 Specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh. 24,300
Processor Mediatek Helio P35
Operating System Android 10, ColorOS 7.2
Internal 4GB RAM, 128GB
Connectivity GSM / HSPA / LTE
Rear Camera 50MP + 2 MP + 2 MP
Front Camera 16 MP
Display 6.51 inch IPS LCD
Battery Li-Po 5000mAh
Charging Fast charging 18W

Design and build

Starting off with the design. It’s not hard to miss how the Oppo A55 looks Chi in its rainbow-ish color. The phone shows some rainbow hues depending on the angle of the lighting. This is the case with the Rainbow Blue version but it Is also available in Starry Black and Green. Located at the back, it’s a triple rear camera, LED flash, and Oppo branding. It does fill well built even though it is made out of polycarbonate material. The back has a glossy finish so make sure to take advantage of the free case included in the box. This one is a fingerprint magnet that is what we are trying to say.

Flipping up to its front, it’s got a hole punch notch on the upper left for the selfie camera. While on the top part is the earpiece. The bezels are thin, but they have a pretty thick chin. There’s no mention of any glass protection, but Oppo A55 comes with screen protection preinstalled. On the left side of the phone are the volume controls and a triple card tray for two nano-SIM cards and a microSD card. While on the right side are the power/unlock button, which also doubles as a fingerprint scanner. Download the bottom are the main microphone, 3.5-millimeter headphone Jack, USB-C port, and the loudspeaker.

Cameras

Oppo A55 has got triple rear shooters utilizing a 50-megapixel main camera, 2-megapixel macro, and a 2-megapixel one for depth sensing. Flipping over to its front. And we have a 16-megapixel selfie shooter. Checking out the quality, oftentimes photo looks decent with enough details and sharpness. Colors are often accurate and the dynamic range is decent. There’s also a macro camera, but as expected, it produces low-quality images. On the other hand, selfies can be very good which is what Oppo is well known for. Just make sure to have good lighting. When it comes to videos, this phone can take up to 1080 P of 30 frames per second just like most smartphones at this price point.

Display

Now more on the display, the Oppo A55 has a 6.51-inch IPS LCD panel with a resolution of 1600 by 720 capable of having 270 PPI. Even though it only has an LCD panel, surprisingly, it produces a bunch of colors and has decent viewing angles. This device gives an immersive viewing experience when watching content on YouTube o Netflix. The display as it is bright and vibrant. In the display settings, you can choose the screen temperature to cool, default, and warm. You can also opt to choose what dark mode style you prefer. Overall, this display is decent and will suffice your daily needs.

Platform

Powering the Oppo A55 is a MediaTek MT6765G Helio G35 (12 nm) chipset that is paired with a PowerVR GE8320 GPU, 4GB RAM, and 64 GB of internal storage. It can handle basic tasks and it is good for day-to-day tasks. Well, this isn’t a gaming smartphone, so don’t expect too much really. But you know, overall the MediaTek MT6765G Helio G35 performs smoothly for basic activities, such as video streaming, social media browsing, and anything of that like.

And when it comes to audio, this device only comes with a single downward-firing speaker with a quality that usually comes with its price range. It’s good for voice calls and listening to podcasts, but you’ll be better off with headphones for a listening experience. Good thing. There’s a 3.5-millimeter audio port. So you don’t need to worry about getting a wireless pair of earbuds if at all that is a turnoff.

Battery and more

Oppo A55 comes with the usual connectivity features such as dual SIM, 4G LTE, Wifi, Bluetooth 5.0, GPS, USB type C, and the 3.5-millimeter audio jack. Powering it is a 5,000 mAh battery with support for 18W fast charging. This is an ample amount to last you a full day of usage. As for biometrics and security, you can choose between facial recognition or the side-mounted fingerprint scanner. Both work as intended, but we highly recommend you use the fingerprint scanner for a higher level of security. Running on the Oppo A55 is Android 11, ColorOS 11.1. Overall, if you’re familiar with and used to this UI, it’s basically straightforward to use.

Our take

Oppo released another budget smartphone for the year 2021, the Oppo A55. It offers a large 6.51 inches display, triple rear cameras, a MediaTek MT6765G Helio G35 (12 nm) processor, and a 5,000 mAh battery. Seems like the design of this phone might have been the primary focus. But overall, the design is not that unique from other A-series, but still, it is a fun one, especially in this colorway on the Rainbow Blue version. It is also more comfortable to grip in easy to hold compared to its predecessors.

Oppo Reno 7 4G FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

  1. How much does Oppo A55 cost? – The base approximate price of the Oppo A55 was around 24,500 shillings in Kenya.
  2. What is the release date for Oppo A55? – The official release date is 2021, October 01.
  3. What is the screen size of Oppo A55, and how big is it? – The screen size of the Oppo A55 is 6.51″ inches.
  4. Does Oppo A55 support 5G? – No, it does not support 5G
  5. Is Oppo A55 waterproof? – No, it is not waterproof.
  6. Does Oppo A55 have fast charging? – Yes, it supports fast charging.
  7. Does Oppo A55 have wireless charging? – No, it does not support wireless charging.
  8. Does Oppo A55 have to Google Play Services? – Yes, it supports the services of Google Play Store, Gmail, youtube, etc.
  9. How many cameras does the Oppo A55 have? – There is a Triple main camera and a single selfie camera.

  • Oppo A76

Bose QuietComfort 35 Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones II deliver everything you need to be productive: world-class noise cancellation, Bluetooth for quick wireless connectivity, and a dual-mic system to make or receive clear phone calls, even in loud environments.

With Alexa and Google Assistant built-in, you can control music, send & receive texts, and get answers using just your voice – without looking at your phone. Just press and hold the Action button, and start talking. With Bose QuietComfort 35 Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones II you can be free from wires by connecting easily to your devices with Bluetooth and NFC pairing. They feature up to 20 hours of wireless listening per charge and are designed with premium materials that make them lightweight and comfortable for all-day wear.

  • Bluetooth® and NFC pairing
  • Voice access to Alexa and the Google Assistant

description:
Infinix Zero X Pro in Kenya

The Infinix Zero X Pro price in Kenya is around Ksh 34,500. The Zero X features a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a 120 Hz refresh rate. The phone is powered by MediaTek Helio G95 SoC with up to 8GB of RAM and 128 or 256GB storage. It also comes with a triple 108MP + 8MP+ 8MP main camera and a 4500 mAh battery. Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Infinix Zero X Pro specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya Ksh. 34,500
Display 6.67 inches, AMOLED, 120Hz
Processor MediaTek Helio G95
Sim Card Dual SIM
Connectivity GSM / HSPA / LTE
OS Android 11
RAM 8GB
ROM 256GB
Card Slot microSDXC
Camera 108MP + 8MP+ 8MP
Selfie 16MP
3.5mm jack Yes
USB Port USB Type-C 2.0
Fingerprint under display
Battery Li-Po 4500 mAh
Charging Fast Charging 45W, 40% in 15 min (advertised)
Colors Nebula Black, Starry Silver, Tuscany Brown

Unboxing

For the unboxing experience, the Infinix Zero X Pro comes in three colors. These are Nebula Black, Starry Silver, and Tuscany Brown. In the box, you’ll find the SIM ejector tool, a one X gold note, a beautiful case made by Oraimo. Also inside the box is a pair of earphones, a USB type C cable, and a 45 Watts charger.

Build quality

For the build quality, the Infinix Zero X Pro has a plastic frame, glass rear, and glass front. It weighs 193 grams which makes it a light smartphone. It’s easy to carry around it’s boxy and has rounded corners that make it look just like the iPhone 12, or should we say the iPhone 13? This phone, externally, has a 3.5mm jack, a mic, a USB Type-C 2.0 port, and a mono speaker. Well, the dual speaker would have been nice yes? See The likes of Redmi Note 10 and Redmi Note 10 Pro smartphones.

On the left side, Zero X Pro has a dual nano-SIM card and memory card tray for this 4g smartphone. And at the top there is nothing. Towards the right side is where you’re going to find the volume, keys, and power buttons.

One key feature that differentiates the Infinix zero X pro from the Infinix zero X is the placement of the fingerprint scanner. The zero X pro fingerprint scanner is located on the display. The fingerprint scanner is fast, but not as fast as the side Mount fingerprint scanner on the zero X. Face analog feature is present on this smartphone.

Display

This phone’s display is a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a resolution of 1080 by 2,400 pixels. The display has one 120Hz refresh rate and a 240Hz touch sampling rate that makes scrolling and touch response fast on the phone. This display is colorful, vibrant, and bright. It does have a respectable 700 nits (peak) brightness. This 6.67-inch display size is great. Its camera punch-hole isn’t all that big and it doesn’t distract your content. The colors are very good on this display seeing that it is an AMOLED panel. Furthermore, this panel supports HDR 10 and HDR HLG.

108 MP, and Cameras

Switching to the rear of the Infinix Zero X Pro you’ll find the 108 MP, f/1.8, (wide), 1/1.52″, PDAF, OIS main camera, the 8 MP, f/3.4, 125mm (periscope telephoto), the 8 MP, f/2.3, 13mm, 120˚ (ultrawide) camera and flash LED lights. Infinix Zero X Pro comes with a 16 MP, (wide) selfie camera right there and a flashlight.

For portrait shots in good lighting conditions, it takes good pictures. You can’t turn off the beauty mode, smooth your face, which is unfortunate. Video quality is caped at [email protected], [email protected] for the main camera, and [email protected] for the selfie shooter. The main camera is impressive. The colors look very good. It takes sharp pictures. Portrait shots on the main camera are impressive. The 8 MP, f/3.4, 125mm (periscope telephoto) goes from 5X all the way to 60X zoom.

Platform and performance

To the phone’s performance now, yes? Infinix Zero X Pro is powered by the Mediatek Helio G95 (12 nm) processor. Infinix, not Phoneplace Kenya, says it’s a dual-chip flagship gaming processor because it has an intelligent display chip that is designed to give it maximum power and performance. The Zero X Pro is a very capable budget smartphone.

For multitasking, it comes with 8 gigabytes of RAM. Later on, through a software update, you will be able to expand this to 11 gigabytes via what Infinix calls “memory fusion technology”. What this means is if you have enough storage space, you will have the option to use your storage as RAM. For the battery department, Infinix Zero X Pro comes with a Li-Po 4500 mAh battery. You will just love fast Charging 45W, 40% in 15 min.

Android 12?

As far as the operating system goes, Infinix Zero X Pro comes with Android 11 with XOS 7.6. According to Infinix, this model will get an Android 12 update. That’s a step in the right direction! Also, be pleased to learn that you will not get any ads on this phone. Finally! Onboard is Infinix’s own voice assistant which is fun to play around with. What makes it even more fun is that you do not need an internet connection to use it.

It has a 6.5 inches display, an A13 Bionic chipset, 4GB RAM, 3969mAh Battery, and A triple 12MP camera. Flex your photography skills with the triple-camera system on the iPhone 11 Pro Max, delivering pro performance without the complexity, uncompromising all-day battery life, and an intuitive machine-learning chip that customizes to suit you! You can buy the latest Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max at PhonePlace.

Apple iPhone 11 Pro Max features

  • Release Date: 2019, September
  • Screen: 6.5 inches, “Super Retina XDR OLED display
  • Main Camera: Triple 12 MP
  • Selfie Camera: Dual 12 MP
  • Memory: 64/256/512GB 4GB RAM
  • Chipset: Apple A13 Bionic (7 nm+)
  • OS: iOS 13, up gradable to iOS 13.3
  • Battery: 3969 mAh
  • Sensors: Face ID, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, compass, barometer
  • IP68-Rated water resistant up to 2m for 30 minutes
  • Dimensions: 158 x 77.8 x 8.1 mm
  • Weight: 226 g

Shoot like a pro even when you are not with the incredible cameras of this Apple iPhone. It boasts of a three-camera system, i.e. ultra-wide camera, wide camera, and telephoto camera, which work together seamlessly as one to give you an exceptional shooting experience. This top-class Apple phone features a 12MP rear sensor that lets you capture beautiful and stunning pictures on the fly. It incorporates next-generation Smart HDR technology to finesse highlight and shadow detail in your image, giving it a lifelike feel. Furthermore, this Apple phone features Optical image stabilization that keeps the captured shots, blur-free.

What more, it also lets you shoot 4K video with extended dynamic range and cinematic video stabilization at 60fps. Thanks to its 12MP TrueDepth camera, this smartphone enables you to take slow-motion selfies or videos at 120 fps. The three-camera system performs smooth transitions from one camera to the next, depending on the surroundings. So, no matter whether you are shooting videos, photos, portraits, time-lapse, or even slo-mo videos, you will always have top-quality shots. Also, this Apple smartphone has a night mode that uses intelligent software and A13 Bionic chip to deliver low-light shots.

Pro-grade camera in your pocket

Capture 4x the scene without all the complexity of a DSLR with the expanded Ultra-Wide camera of the iPhone 11 Pro Max. Achieve beautiful images in the dark with the Night Mode and shoot high-quality videos and edit them with the same tools you love for photos.

Shoot videos in 4K at 60fps across both cameras and match the audio zoom with the visual zoom, slow down selfies to a cool 120fps, flatter your subject with portrait mode letting you intensify the lighting, and Smart HDR to recognize faces and intelligently relight them.

Super Retina XDR OLED display

Adapts to external brightness up to 800nits when in the sun for greater viewing and up to 1200nits for HDR photos and movies with a massive 458 pixels per inch on the custom iPhone 11 Pro Max OLED display!

Power in your Hands

This Apple 11 Pro Max smartphone takes mobile computing to a new high. It is powered by a power-efficient A13 Bionic chip with 64-bit Fusion architecture that is intelligent and wickedly powerful. It handles everyday tasks smoothly, be it opening and closing of applications, running of heavy-duty games, or even video editing. The 4GB RAM ensures you seamless multitasking performance. The combination of highly advanced CPU, GPU, and Neural engine ensures it delivers a top-class performance while consuming less power.

Incredible Battery Life

Do more without worrying too much about the battery life with this Apple 4GB RAM smartphone. It packs in a high-capacity battery that will easily last for elongated periods on one single full charge. What’s more, it incorporates fast charging technology that enables you to charge up to 50 percent of the battery in just under 30 minutes. Also, this mobile supports wireless charging, so you can charge it anywhere you want to.

Styled to Perfection

This Apple 4G LTE mobile phone is precision-milled from high-class materials that impart it a stunning and captivating look. It uses robust and durable glass on its front and back, which resists breaking. Also, it has an excellent IP68 rating, which means you do not have to think twice before carrying the phone inside a swimming pool for some time. Also, this phone is spill-resistant, so even if you drop common liquids on it like coffee, tea, and soda, you need not worry. Furthermore, it features precision-fitted seals that provide excellent dust resistance, making it perfect for use even in a desert

Check out the latest Apple iPhone & Prices in Kenya.

Nokia C1 2nd Edition

The Nokia C1 2nd Edition price in Kenya is Ksh 7,400. The phone comes with a 5.45-inch HD+ screen with a polycarbonate body and runs on a quad-core processor with 1 GB of RAM, 16 GB storage, and works on Android 11 Go Edition. A 2,500 mAh removable battery powers the Nokia C1 2nd Edition. It has a 5 MP rear camera and 5 MP front camera with LED flash and support for HDR imaging. The phone offers you an amazing performance with cool features and specifications for its price. Buy Nokia phones in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Nokia C1 2nd Edition specs and price in Kenya

Price Ksh. 7,400

Processor Unisoc SC7731e
Sim Card Dual SIM
Connectivity 4G

Display and Camera

Yes, there are bezels here on this 2021 smartphone. Bummer! They are both on the top and at the bottom. Its display on the other hand is a 5.45 inches TFT capacitive touchscreen with a 480 x 960 pixels resolution. The Nokia C1 2nd Edition display has an 18:9 ratio and 197 PPI density. By the way, the video recording here is [email protected] as one would expect. With the design and display of this phone, there isn’t much difference compared to the Nokia C1 Plus smartphone from 2021, January 29.

I want to think that anyone who wishes to buy Nokia C1 2nd Edition will be asking too much if s/he  asked for more than this phone has to offer. Even for its display even for its cameras. Here is a 5 MP, f/2.4, AF main camera, and a bright 5 MP front-facing camera. I say bright because it is accompanied by an LED flash.

Android 11 (Go edition)

From features that make the world more inclusive to tools that change lives, Android (Go edition) is a platform with a major impact. The lens in Google Go reads written language out loud, helping more people understand the world around them. On Android (Go edition), Google apps are built from the ground up—so apps use less space, save data and stay loaded with power. They are giving users new tools to capture the perfect shot. Or listen to a webpage. While keeping everything faster, more helpful, and easier to use – from the source Google.

Battery

Nokia has a splendid reputation with battery lives. On Nokia C1 2nd Edition is a removable (yes removable) Li-Ion 2500 mAh battery. We rarely see removable batteries these days, but for those who wish to have a phone with it, try Nokia C1. Get 2-3 days of usage with this battery capacity – see also the Nokia C1 phone.

Nokia C1 2nd Edition FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

  1. When was C1 2nd Edition released? – The official release date is 2021, July 05.
  2. How big is the display of the Nokia C1 2nd Edition? – The screen size of the C1 2nd Edition is 5.45″ inches.
  3. Does the C1 2nd Edition support 5G? – No, it does not support 5G.
  4. Does the C1 2nd Edition have Google services? – Yes, it supports the services of Google Play Store, Gmail, youtube, etc.
  5. Does the Nokia C1 2nd Edition support fast charge? – No, it does not support fast charging.
  6. Is the C1 2nd Edition waterproof? – No, it is not waterproof.

description:
Vivo Y53s

The Vivo Y53s price in Kenya is Ksh 28,500 shillings. Y53s is a budget mid-range smartphone that comes with 8 gigabytes of RAM, expandable to 11 gigabytes. It has a Full HD plus display for your viewing pleasure, a 64-megapixel main camera that takes decent pictures, and a 5,000 mAh battery with a 33w fast charger (included in the box). Buy it in Kenya today at Phoneplace Kenya.

Vivo Y53s specs & price in Kenya

Price in Kenya   Ksh. 28,500
Camera 64MP+2MP+2MP
Selfie  16 MP
Display 6.58 inches
Storage 128 GB
Ram  8GB
Chipset Mediatek Helio G80
Battery  Li-Po 5000 mAh

Unboxing

Opening the box the first you’ll see is the smartphone. It is available in colors Black, Blue, and Silver with two-tone colors. Inside the box are a quick guide manual, information on the warranty card, a 33W fast charger used with type C cable, and headphones.

Design

For its build quality, Vivo Y53s has a plastic rear, plastic frame, and glass at the front. The front does come with a film screen protector installed on it. We’ll definitely advise you to get a plastic or glass screen protector just to be safe. And now that we are being safe, should you submerge this phone in water for some minutes, it should be fine. Externally, it comes to the 3.5 mm audio jack, a mic, a USB Type-C port, and a mono speaker.

On the right side is where you find the volume keys and the power buttons. The power button doubles as the fingerprint scanner. Setting it up is fast and using it is even faster at about 0.2 seconds to unlock the smartphone. The face unlock feature is also available here and works very well. At the phone’s top, that is Vivo Y53s is a secondary microphone and a SIM card tray. The phone can take two Nanos SIM cards and a memory card.

Display

For the display, the Vivo Y53s S has a 6.5 inch Full HD display with a resolution of 1080 x 2408 pixels. It’s an IPS LCD panel with a 60 Hz refresh rate and for an IPSS panel, the colors at the descent. The panel is bright and consuming media on this device is enjoyable.

Cameras

Now moving to the camera department. On Vivo Y53s’ rear, you will see the triple camera setup. These are a 64 MP, f/1.8, 26mm (wide), 1/1.97″, 0.7µm, PDAF, a 2 MP, f/2.4, (macro) and a 2MP depth sensor. It also comes with flash LED delight. Now switching to the front, it comes to the 16-megapixel camera. It takes decent pictures. Using the portrait mode, however, will produce mixed results. Now switching back to the 64 megapixels main camera is impressive. Colors are natural considering the price of this device. Awesome portrait shots with the main camera unlike with the selfie. So good thing there.

Performance

On to performance, the Vivo Y53s comes with either Qualcomm SM4350 Snapdragon 480 5G or Mediatek Helio G80 processor depending on your region. It’s (Mediatek) a 12-nanometer processor that offers boosted clock speed, smooth performance and enhanced powered efficiency. This one is good for people that do a lot of multitasking on their smartphones. Speaking of which, this phone comes with 8 gigabytes of RAM and 3 gigabytes of the phone storage can be converted to RAM making it 11 gigabytes of RAM. That’s quite impressive. There is that Game Assistant feature that optimizes the phone for the best gaming experience. Great news for gamers we suppose.

Battery

For the battery, Vivo Y53s comes to the 5,000 mAh battery that easily lasts the entire day. What’s impressive for me is the charging time. It takes one hour eight minutes to charge this smartphone from zero to 100%. And the battery seems to last a long, long time. Its charging speed is caped at fast-charging 18W, according to GSM Arena. But the phone itself comes with a 33W fast charger included.

The perfectly aligned magnets keep it attached to your iPhone 12 or iPhone 12 Pro — providing safe and reliable wireless charging. And it automatically charges, so there’s no need to turn it on or off. There’s no interference with your credit cards or key fobs either.

Key Features

  • For iPhone 12, mini, Pro & Pro Max

description:
Apple AirTag

Apple AirTag price in Kenya is Ksh 6,500 for the 1 pack and Ksh 18,000 for the 4 pack. The AirTag is an easy way to keep track of your stuff. Attach one to your keys, slip another one in your backpack. And just like that, they’re on your radar in the Find My app. Apple AirTag has your back. AirTag. Keep track of your keys, wallet, luggage, backpack, and more, all in the Find My app. Play a sound on the built-in speaker, or say “Hey Siri, find my gym bag.” With select iPhone models, Precision Finding can lead you right to your nearby AirTag. If it’s farther away, hundreds of millions of Apple devices in the Find My network can help track it down. All anonymously and encrypted for privacy.

Apple AirTag Features:

  • Keep track of and find your items alongside friends and devices in the Find My app
  • A simple 1-tap setup instantly connects AirTag with your iPhone or iPad
  • Play a sound on the built-in speaker to help find your things, or just ask Siri for help
  • Precision Finding with Ultra-Wideband technology leads you right to your nearby AirTag (on select iPhone models)
  • Find items farther away with the help of hundreds of millions of Apple devices in the Find My network
  • Put AirTag into Lost Mode to be automatically notified when it’s detected in the Find My network
  • All communication with the Find My network is anonymous and encrypted for privacy
  • Location data and history are never stored on AirTag
  • Replaceable battery lasts over a year
  • AirTag is IP67 water and dust resistant
  • Make AirTag yours with a range of colorful accessories
