description:
Apple iPad Pro 11-Inch 2018

Finally it is with us. This is my review of the Apple iPad Pro 11. And I will say this before I go any further, it is the Pro 11 because its display is an 11 inch view estate. But that will not be the only reason you will remember this one for, as you will find out shortly. This one was announced and released on October of 2018 and November of that very year respectively. It was long awaited, and it is finally here. Share in my thoughts about the Apple iPad Pro 11 as I descriptively talk about it in this article. Below is a list of its key features, just about what you should expect with it, or from it in a nutshell.

Main features

  • GSM, CDMA, HSPA, EVDO and LTE network technology
  • 468 g
  • Nano-SIM, Electronic SIM card (eSIM)
  • – Stylus support (Bluetooth integration; magnetic)
  • LED-backlit IPS LCD, capacitive touchscreen, 16M colors
  • 11.0 inches, 366.5 cm2 (~82.9% screen-to-body ratio)
  • 1668 x 2388 pixels (~265 ppi density)
  • Scratch-resistant glass, oleophobic coating
  • – Wide color gamut display
    – True-tone display
    – 120 Hz
  • iOS 12, upgradable to iOS 12.1
  • Apple A12X Bionic (7 nm) chipset
  • Octa-core (4×2.5 GHz Vortex + 4×1.6 GHz Tempest) CPU
  • Apple GPU (7-core graphics) GPU
  • 1 TB, 6 GB RAM or 64/256/512 GB, 4 GB RAM
  • Primary camera
    12 MP, f/1.8, 29mm (standard), 1/3″, 1.22µm, PDAF
  • Quad-LED dual-tone flash, HDR
  • [email protected]/60fps, [email protected]/60/120fps, [email protected] video recording
  • Selfie camera
  • 7 MP, f/2.2, 32mm (standard)
  • Face detection, HDR, panorama
  • [email protected] video recording
  • Loudspeakers Yes, with stereo speakers (4 speakers)
  • – Active noise cancellation with dedicated mic
  • Wi-Fi 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac, dual-band, hotspot
  • Bluetooth 5.0, A2DP, LE, EDR
  • GPS Yes, with A-GPS, GLONASS, GALILEO, QZSS (Wi-Fi + Cellular model only)
  • USB 3.1, Type-C 1.0 reversible connector; magnetic connector
  • Face ID, accelerometer, gyro, proximity, barometer
  • Non-removable Li-Po 7812 mAh battery (29.45 Wh)
  • – Power Bank/ reverse charging
  • Available in Silver or Space Gray

Design and build of the Apple iPad Pro 11

Notice one thing about this tablet, in its name you see the word Pro. Now this word can mean many things, good for example- which can be an understatement so great. Or maybe perfect. The list is long. This is a Pro gadget in many ways and its looks and feel have to make the list. It is a tablet with a very professional look and feel. It has this clean finish on both the front and back. An 11 inch display panel sits on the front with bezels very well reduced.

Looking at it side by side with previous Apple tablets, the difference cannot be missed, an approach that has seen the Pro 11 add to is looks overall and make room for a large yet manageable tablet. The top bezel has a selfie camera of course and sensors for Face ID. Let it be known that this iPad Pro 11 is the first Apple tablet to have face ID, along with the Apple iPad Pro 12.9 which I have done a separate review for on Phone Place Kenya. Check it out it is on I consider the bigger brother of this. The back has the primary camera and LED flash on the very top right corner. Some will argue left others right, but what does not change is that it is placed on a top corner. That Apple logo also shines on the back panel as you would expect.

Additional detail

There are two attachable parts of the iPad Pro 11. The first is a keyboard (bought separately) that when attached makes you use your tablet as a computer, or almost and the other is a stylus pen (comes with tablet) that has been improved from previous ones in quite a number of ways. Most notable is that it is not slit inside the tablet but it has a magnetic feature that lets it stick to the side of the Pro 11, and stick it does. It is also Bluetooth integrated.

Display

And many will throw shade at Apple for not going with an AMOLED panel here. But, I am here on Apple’s defense. That LED-backlit IPS LCD capacitive touch screen is as good as an AMOLED panel. Again I say, it is. How I would describe it is that it is sharp, crisp and clear on an 11.0 inches, 366.5 cm2 (~82.9% screen-to-body ratio) display estate.  That sharpness is as a result of the 1668 x 2388 pixels (~265 ppi density) resolution it comes with. Viewing angles here are as wide as you would expect from a phone of this caliber.  It is protected by a scratch-resistant glass that Apple terms oleophobic coating. This is a wide color gamut true-tone display that boasts 120 Hz.

Cameras

Primary camera

I did mention that this is not your average tablet device. And in this department (also) I will defend my thoughts. On many occasions companies include mediocre cameras on tablets just because tablets aren’t daily drivers for photography. Well not, Apple, and most definitely not on the iPad Pro 11. Here we get a 12 MP, f/1.8, 29mm (standard), 1/3″, 1.22µm, PDAF main camera with a Quad-LED dual-tone flash. That HDR feature is also very available here and there is [email protected]/60fps, [email protected]/60/120fps, [email protected] video recording, that’s 4K.

Selfie camera

A standard 7 MP, f/2.2, 32mm shooter it is that won’t only serve your video calls features but also can be used as a selfie photo session driver. Why? Because it is as crisp as it could get.

Both these cameras are super impressive and will always turn up to meet you expectations. That you can count on.  

Performance and memory

Platform

The iPad 11 Pro runs iOS 12 which upgradable to iOS 12.1 and will always be upgradable whenever an update is rolled. It rocks an Apple A12X Bionic (7 nm) chipset an Octa-core (4×2.5 GHz Vortex + 4×1.6 GHz Tempest) CPU and an Apple GPU (7-core graphics) GPU. High end specifications these, you don’t even a blind man could see.

Memory

1 TB, 6 GB RAM or 64/256/512 GB, 4 GB RAM. There is not room for memory expansion here. But really though, with 1TB doubt anyone would need more space.  You pay more for larger memory of course that should go without say.

Battery

The most interesting thing about the Non-removable Li-Po 7812 mAh battery of the Apple iPad Pro 11 is that it can hold enough charge to charge another smartphone. Now that is something you do not see every day. This is a tablet that serves as a power bank as well. Oh and that battery capacity should last up to a whole day of usage, or more.

 

Pros Cons
  • Great design and build
  • Impressive cameras
  • High end platform performance
  • Large battery with power bank feature
  • Can be used as a computer when keyboard is attached
  • Large internal memory 1TB
  • Improved security with Face ID
  • Expensive

 

Apple iPad 11 Pro is available in Silver or Space Gray. Buys yours today.

description:
OnePlus 8 in Kenya

The price of OnePlus 8 in Kenya is around 63,900 shillings. The phone comes with a 6.55-inch display, Snapdragon 865, 8GB RAM,128GB Storage, and 4300 mAh battery. On 2020, April 14, OnePlus finally announced the OnePlus 8 (and 8 Pro), which confirmed rumors of a triple camera and the 90Hz display that the phone maker has been teasing since January. Here is our review of the phone.

OnePlus 8 specs and price in Kenya

Price in Kenya   Ksh. 63,900
Camera 48 MP + 16 MP + 2 MP
Selfie  16MP
Display  6.5 inches, IPS LCD
Storage  128GB
Chipset Snapdragon 865
O.S  Android 10
Battery  Li-Po 4300 mAh

Slim and Sleek Curved Design

The OnePlus 8 feels quite familiar in the hand. It’s almost identical to the 7 Pro and OnePlus 7T Pro – from the curves down to dimensions and bezels. There are a couple of subtle differences though and you will notice most of them the moment you begin to use this phone. It has been crafted with remarkable precision OnePlus 8. The phone itself looks stunning, weighs about 180 grams, and measures 160.2 x 72.9 x 8 mm in dimensions. It is available in three elegant color variants. The OnePlus 8 comes in Onyx Black, Glacial Green, and Interstellar Glow. Oh yes and a refined Matte AG finish you shall see on the Glacial Green variant. The result thereof is reduced fingerprints and glare hence great looks and feel.

90 Hz refresh rate

Very quickly let us bring everyone to speed with what this is. A 90 Hz refresh rate that allows you to swipe, scroll, and navigate with ease. A refresh rate is the number of times your monitor updates with new images each second. For example, a 90 Hz refresh rate means the display updates 90 times per second. Such is what the OnePlus 8 brings with its 6.55 inches Fluid Display. The company describes it as the 6.55″ Fluid Display flows seamlessly from one frame to the next – then the whole refresh rate thing follows. Important to note is that this screen is an  AMOLED capacitive touchscreen which does have 16M colors. 

Fluid Display features

Oh wait, there is more to this display. It isn’t just a regular everyday smartphone screen you find on any smartphones. Firstly, note that this is a display that supports HDR10+. There is more to see with HDR10+ notwithstanding that it (the display) has an A+ rating from DisplayMate and an SGS Eye Care Display Certification. We need also to have you know that this one has 1080 x 2400 pixels resolution with a cinematic 20:9 ratio. Natural accuracy is what this screen aims to present. Colors are quite true to life thanks to a calibrated display that provides sensational color accuracy. To put it simply, the display of the OnePlus 8 is designed to impress. Do not let it skip your notice it has a punch hole at the top left corner where the selfie camera sits.

Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ 865

The Qualcomm® Snapdragon™ 865 is the chipset of the year 2020. Bad as the year had started with a global health crisis, this chipset remains as good as we are about to show you. First of all this chipset delivers up to 25% faster (flagship) performance than previous generation Snapdragons. X Dual Mode 5G and UFS 3.0 storage infrastructure come with it. Tell you what, OnePlus 8 brings you the next generation of WiFi with WiFi 6 with peak speeds up to 270%* faster than before. Thanks to SD 865 you also get Smart 5G to switching between 5G and non-5G networks to prolong battery life and maintain your connection.

The price of the OnePlus 8 is 64,500 shillings in Kenya for the 128GB + 8GB RAM version. 12 GB RAM + 256 GB OnePlus 8 costs around 68,000 Kenya shillings. These are the two storage options you will have to choose from. Now that this is out of the way, let us also mention that the OnePlus 8 runs Android 10.0 with OxygenOS 10.0 straight out of the box. The phone has an Octa-core (1×2.84 GHz Kryo 585 & 3×2.42 GHz Kryo 585 & 4×1.8 GHz Kryo 585) CPU and an Adreno 650 GPU. As for sound performance, the OnePlus 8 has a powerful dual stereo speaker to deliver more immersive and detailed sound. With it, you get to enjoy a cinematic, 3D listening experience with Dolby Atmos’ support. Enhanced haptic vibration also gives you better feedback with every tap and swipe whilst you interact with your new OnePlus 8.

48 MP Triple Camera

The way we would package the triple camera of the OnePlus 8 is this. Macro Mode 2.0 lets you focus on subjects just 4cm away, so you can bring more details into focus. Selfie portrait (16MP wide selfie) for taking high-quality selfies wherever, whenever. Finally, intelligent multi-frame processing to add brightness, clarity, and detail to low-light scenes. It is an advanced 48 MP triple Camera system. We also take this moment to acknowledge the remarkably and dramatically improved video stabilization this camera is capable of.

It is just amazing even to know that 4K video recording is present here at [email protected]/60fps. By the way, buy OnePlus 8 if you have, or love pets. Here is why there are software algorithms that automatically detect when pets are in the frame and adjust the settings on the fly to reduce motion blur and help you capture your pets at their cutest. That third lens is a 116° Ultra wide-angle camera. It also has a 16 MP resolution. 

OnePlus 8 Battery

Power up your day and night with the 4300 mAh battery of OnePlus 8 and enjoy fast charging 30W which delivers 50% in just 22 minutes. OnePlus 8 can deliver the power need you desire for a whole day’s use. Be sure to take advantage of it. Find out more about this phone by following this link.

Check out the latest OnePlus Phones in Kenya

description:

Phone features

Wiko Y61 smartphone has an IPS LCD display. It measures 161.3 mm x 78.1 mm x 9 mm and weighs 190 grams. The screen has a resolution of FWVGA+ (480*960), pixel density : 179 ppi. It is backed by a 3000 mAh battery. Connectivity features in the smartphone include WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS, and more.

Wiko Y61 smartphone runs on Android 8.1 Oreo operating system. The phone is powered by MediaTek 6761WE, Quad-Core 1.8 GHz processor. It runs on the MediaTek 6761WE Chipset. It has 2 GB RAM and 32 GB internal storage. You may also want to see J2 Core 2020.

It’s so fast to browse the Internet, play around on social media and download/upload your content of the moment at high speed with 4G – website.

All is wider and clearer at any angle on Wiko Y61 ‘s large IPS display, which fits comfortably in your hand. Its reliable package has you covered with an ample 32GB of memory, 2GB RAM, a long lasting 3000 mAh battery and 4G speed. What’s more, it’s full of user friendly features like Google Assistant Button, Camera Go and Simple mode, making it a breeze to use! You may also like Wiko Sunny 4.

description:
Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact

This article is about Sony’s new addition to its line of Xperia smartphones, the Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact. Below are its key features.

 

4.6 inches display panel

720 x 1280 pixels resolution

19MP primary camera

8MP secondary camera

32GB internal memory + 4GB RAM

Snapdragon 835 chipset

Octa core CPU

Adreno 540 GPU

Android Oreo 8.0

IPS68 water and dust resistant over 1.5m and for 30 min

Non removable 2700mAh battery with fast battery charging

 

The Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact is the smaller version of the Sony Xperia XZ1 which has a bigger 5.2 inches display panel. All other features are the same on these two. Sony makes all its flagship devices in this manner, a big model for big sized phone lovers and a small version of the same phone for the other group. It isn’t only a Sony thing but also something most flagship makers like Samsung and HTC do. This article will give an in depth analysis of the Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact.

 

Design and build

It features the same design as the Xperia XZ1. Except for its size and weight, every other design and build detail is the same. It has that signature Xperia design that you can tell by just looking at any Xperia smartphone. . It has these dimensions 129 x 64 x 9.3 mm and weighs 140 grams. This phone is thicker than the XZ1 because it has the same battery capacity as it yet is smaller. Its thickness allows room for packing the battery. On its back is the primary camera on the top right corner and besides it (centrally placed) it a slim dark bar that houses the LED flash and other details. Facing you is a symmetrical top and bottom bezel. The bottom on has a speaker come mouth piece while the top bezel has a sensor on one side of the call speaker and the selfie camera on the other. Below the call speaker is SONY branding. The build is all metallic and the design is so elegant and appealing to the eye. A premium look it has and a beauty it is this smartphone. There is XPERIA branding on the middle back of this beautiful phone.

It is IP68 water and dust resistant up to 30 min and over 1.5 m and has a side mounted fingerprint scanner (placed on the power button). It has a dedicated camera button on the same side as the power button while the volume rocker lies on the other side of the phone.

 

Display and camera

The Xperia XZ1 comes with a 4.6 inches display panel which is an IPS LSC capacitive touch screen of 16M colors and has support of up to 10 finger multi touch. It has a 1080 x 1280 pixels (319 ppi pixel density) resolution and a 71% screen to body ratio. Its display is Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protected, is HDR 10 compliant and is a Triluminos display.  It is a fine display, sharp and with good brightness, enough for sunlight readability. It has great viewing angles as well and excellent color representation. It gives an illusion of a 3D display to a keen observer, a trick Sony is making very good use of lately.

 

 

 

 

Camera

The cameras on any Xperia smartphone will always be the best part of it- check yourself you will see. It is no wonder Xperia smartphones come with a dedicated camera button. That is the same case here with the Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact. It has a 19MP primary camera with EIS, predictive phase detection, laser autofocus and an LED flash. The secondary camera is a 13MP shooter with f/2.0 aperture.

Video recording stands at [email protected] up to [email protected] Other camera features present include geo tagging, touch focus, face detection, HDR and panorama.

Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact just like the XZ1 has top notch camera performance with the best of image and video quality a high end smartphone can ever offer in the market today.

 

Performance and memory

It come runs Android 8.0 Oreo with X Reality Engine.

The Xperia XZ1 has a Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 chipset, an octa core (4x 2.45 GHz Kyro & 4 x 1.9 GHz Kyro) CPU and comes with an Adreno 540 GPU.

It has 32 GB + 4GB RAM and the internal memory can be expanded up to 256 GB with an SD card.

The performance of the Xperia XZ1 is seamless, smooth and satisfying.

 

Battery

It comes with a sealed 2700mAH battery and supports fast battery charging (Quick Charge 3.0). It is capacity enough to last a full day of mixed usage. This capacity is very good given the display size on this smartphone, enough to last up to a day and a half of missed usage.

 

Connectivity and network

WLAN (Wi-Fi, Wi-Fi Direct, dual band, DLNA, hotspot), Bluetooth 5.0, GPS (with A GPS, GLONASS, BDS), NFC and 3.1 type C 1.0 reversible connector + USB host.

 

3.5mm jack> 24 bit/192 kHz audio and active noise cancellation with dedicated mic.

 

Network: Single SIM or Dual Hybrid SIM> GSM, HSPA and LTE.

 

The Sony Xperia XZ1 Compact is a solid flagship by Sony. It has good camera performance, battery life and platform performance as well. Comes with the choice of four colors- black, snow silver, horizon blue and twilight pink.
